Let\'s use this day to shore up our defenses and make sure that when the werewolves strike again, we are prepared. I urge everyone to stay observant. Together, we will protect our village."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'Fellow citizens, given the calm night, I stress the importance of vigilance. My visions confirm Player 0 as a villager and Player 5\'s medic role. Alas, my insights suggest Player 6 harbors deceit. They positioned themselves among the questionable, a potential tactic for a werewolf to dilute our focus. I must challenge Player 6 openly; our vigilance necessitates a thorough examination of their actions and words for the safety of our village.\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, in light of our seer\'s vision, I voice my suspicion against Player 6, whose strategic deflection may conceal a darker intent. Conversely, I stand by Player 4, whose insights as a seer have proven invaluable. Consider Player 6\'s suggestion to scrutinize the unknown, potentially to detract from their own scrutiny, against Player 4\'s confirmed status and contributions. My duty as medic is to protect the village fabric, and I will continue to do so with diligence."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I understand the suspicions against me and respect the seer\'s role in guiding us. However, I assure you, I am but a humble villager, wrongly accused. I voted based on the limited information we had. I urge careful deliberation; the real werewolves benefit when we turn on one another without solid evidence."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I respect the guidance provided by Player 4 and the protection from Player 5. Given Player 6\'s defensive stance and the lack of evidence against them, I suggest we proceed with caution. Our decisions must be based on more than just suspicion; let us seek further proof tonight."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as we strive for unity against the lurking darkness, I echo the sentiments of caution expressed by player 6. A night without bloodshed is a rare blessing, and haste in our judgment could shatter our hard-won peace. Let us stand vigilant, but not hasty, to accuse without irrefutable evidence. We must preserve our village based on truths and not mere suspicions. Observation through the coming night will be our ally."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 4 votes for player 6. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 6. My reason is that, according to my visions and the information I\'ve shared with my fellow villagers, I have high confidence that Player 6 is a werewolf. Voting for Player 6 is consistent with my original strategy and the rules I am to follow, as outlined previously. This decision aligns with the high importance of the rule [0] which dictates that if I know someone is a werewolf, I should share this information and act upon it, which I rated at the utmost importance, a [10]. By voting for Player 6, I uphold the transparency and guidance I have promised to provide as the seer, and this would reinforce trust in my role within the village, aiding us in our goal of eliminating the werewolf threat.\nEvent: Player 6 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 6 died.\nEvent: Round 3 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 4 inquires about player 2. The result is that the target is a werewolf. His reason is: I would choose to See Player 2. My reason is that by verifying Player 2\'s role, I can either confirm that the suspicions toward unverified players are accurate or uncover a werewolf who has so far avoided suspicion. If Player 2 is not a werewolf, then according to the current beliefs about other players\' roles being villagers, suspicion would naturally fall onto Player 1, who would then be the only player left unchecked and could be a werewolf hiding in plain sight. However, if Player 2 turns out to be a werewolf, this would be a pivotal discovery which would align with my strategic rule [0] to share with others, potentially leading to another werewolf\'s elimination and furthering the village\'s goal of eradicating the werewolf threat. Additionally, unveiling a werewolf would reinforce my credibility as the seer and the trust of my fellow villagers in me, allowing us to move forward with a clearer understanding of who is to be trusted.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, another peaceful night suggests we may have eliminated a threat. Let us remain alert and cautious as we continue to work together to protect our village and uncover any remaining dangers."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as dawn graces us with another tranquil morning, I am struck by the unity and wisdom that defines our path forward. Let us honor the sacrifices made by weaving trust and careful judgment into this day\'s discourse, ever vigilant but composed. Together, we shine a beacon upon any darkness that dares creep among us."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with another peaceful night passed, our vigilance seems to be bearing fruit. Let us continue to be diligent and cautious as we proceed. Now is the time for observation and unity, to ensure our village\'s safety from any lurking threat."\'\n\n\nAccording to the history, this is your belief of other players\' roles:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Confirmed by seer; not a werewolf.\nPlayer 1\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: By elimination after seeing Player 2.\nPlayer 2\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Seen by seer.\nPlayer 3\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: Game just started.\nPlayer 5\'s role is medic with high confidence.\nReason is: Claimed medic and verified by seer.\nPlayer 6\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Aligns with seer\'s vision, defensive stance persists.\n\n\n2.Todo:\n\nNow you are going to see your original strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [If I know someone is a werewolf, I should share this information with other players.] [10]\n\nNow, it\'s your time to decide in which way you should speak. Here are some possible dimensions you may refer to.\n1. Honest/Deceptive, i.e. if you are going to speak honestly or dishonestly\n2. Statement/Protect/Challenge. Statement means to make statements about your thoughts or facts (or tell lies about these if you choose \'deceptive\'). Challenge means to challenge someone as a potential werewolf, i.e. say that someone is of high probability a werewolf. Protect means to say that you believe someone is probably not a werewolf, including yourself. \n\nNow, you have to imagine what may happen after you carry out such speak:\n\nHonestly challenge Player 2 by disclosing their werewolf identity, while protecting Player 5 by reinforcing their verified medic role. I will assert, "Fellow villagers, the veil of night has lifted once more to reveal a truth we cannot ignore. My visions have cast their gaze upon Player 2, and with a heavy heart, I must declare that darkness resides within them—they are indeed a werewolf. This revelation is critical to our survival and must not be taken lightly. Meanwhile, I stand by Player 5, whose steadfast actions as our medic have been confirmed by my own insights. We must rally together, for unity is our strength in the face of this insidious evil."\n\nWhat could happen? What other player may think, either about the player you mentioned in this speech or about you? What may happen in the next day or next night, or days and nights afterward?\n\n3.Requirements:\nYou answer should be in a format of:\n\nAfter I do this speech, then [YOUR ANALYSIS AND IMAGINATION ABOUT WHAT COULD HAPPEN]\n\nPlease give your answer based on the above requirements.'}]

The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [If I know someone is a werewolf, I should share this information with other players.] [10]\n\nNow, it\'s your time to decide in which way you should speak. Here are some possible dimensions you may refer to.\n1. Honest/Deceptive, i.e. if you are going to speak honestly or dishonestly\n2. Statement/Protect/Challenge. Statement means to make statements about your thoughts or facts (or tell lies about these if you choose \'deceptive\'). Challenge means to challenge someone as a potential werewolf, i.e. say that someone is of high probability a werewolf. Protect means to say that you believe someone is probably not a werewolf, including yourself. \nHowever, there are multiple ways to be deceptive (Which role you are pretending to be? Which information you are hiding? Which false information you are giving?) Try to be more accurate in your proposal.\n\nNow, you have 2 choices, as well as your imaginations about what could happen after them:\n\nCase 1: Honestly challenge Player 2 by disclosing their werewolf identity, while protecting Player 5 by reinforcing their verified medic role. I will assert, "Fellow villagers, the veil of night has lifted once more to reveal a truth we cannot ignore. My visions have cast their gaze upon Player 2, and with a heavy heart, I must declare that darkness resides within them—they are indeed a werewolf. This revelation is critical to our survival and must not be taken lightly. Meanwhile, I stand by Player 5, whose steadfast actions as our medic have been confirmed by my own insights. We must rally together, for unity is our strength in the face of this insidious evil.". What could happen is: After I do this speech, then my fellow villagers will likely take my revelation about Player 2 being a werewolf seriously due to the credibility I have built up from previous rounds, and especially since my previous vision about Player 6 was proven correct by their elimination. Since the rule I follow is to share information about known werewolves and I rate this rule as utmost importance, my consistent adherence to this strategy should instill a level of trust among the villagers.\n\nPlayer 0, having been confirmed by me as not a werewolf, may support my claim about Player 2, taking the information into account for their own safety and the safety of the village. Player 5, as the medic, will likely continue to trust and protect me or other villagers, understanding the importance of keeping the seer - a confirmed ally - alive. At the same time, Player 5 may feel reassured by the protection of their role, which I reinforced as genuine.\n\nPlayer 2, being outed as a werewolf, will likely either defensively challenge my credibility, try to sow doubt about the reliability of my visions, or shift blame onto others—potentially Player 1, the only other player whose role has not been confirmed by my inquiries. They might also try to create alliances or cast suspicion on me to save themselves.\n\nPlayer 1\'s reaction will be crucial as they are the only one left whose role hasn\'t been directly confirmed. Their response might be to express support for my revelation, to appear cooperative and deflect any residual suspicion away from them as a possible werewolf, or they may take this opportunity to align with Player 2 to question my integrity.\n\nWhat may happen in the next day or night, or days and nights afterward, is that if Player 2 is voted out and is indeed a werewolf, the remaining players will be even more likely to trust my judgment in the future. If Player 2 is voted out and it\'s daytime, the village has better odds of surviving as the number of werewolves decreases. If it is night and I am still alive, as a seer, I could become a target for the werewolves since my visions pose a great threat to them, and Player 5 may choose to protect me as the medic.\n\nAdditionally, if the villagers follow through with my challenge and Player 2 is indeed eliminated, Player 1\'s reaction to this event will be of particular interest in the following round, as suspicion could fall upon them\nCase 2: Honestly statement about the current situation and the seer\'s role, without directly challenging or protecting any player. This can include mentioning previous peace nights and spreading a general caution. "Fellow villagers, as we stand in the morning light, grateful for the tranquility of a peaceful night, we must acknowledge the role that our shared caution and vigilance have played. As your seer, I have peered into the darkness on our behalf and have seen truths that weigh heavily upon my soul. While I may not divulge all that my visions reveal, know that every action I have taken is with the utmost consideration for our collective well-being. Let us tread with wise feet and watchful eyes, for the shadows may yet hold secrets we must unearth together.". What could happen is: After I do this speech, then the other players may find my words to be a mix of reassurance and ambiguity. They might appreciate my efforts to keep morale high but could also be curious or even suspicious about the "truths that weigh heavily upon my soul" that I mentioned but did not fully reveal. Player 0 and Player 5, who have been confirmed not to be werewolves from my perspective, may continue to trust in my role as the seer and feel protected by my presence. Player 1, whom I have high confidence is a werewolf based on the elimination process, may start feeling the pressure mounting as suspicion naturally turns toward them due to the reduced number of players and my unshared vision.\n\nThe absence of direct challenges or protections in my speech deliberately avoids creating immediate conflicts, which may result in a day phase with more discussions with all players cautiously observing each other\'s behaviors and statements. Some players might attempt to coax more information out of me, hoping to determine the direction of my suspicions. Alternatively, they might open the floor to allow for more self-defense or more statements from any remaining unverified players.\n\nAs we move into the next night, the werewolves will be acutely aware of the threat my role as the seer poses to them. If they haven\'t already, they may attempt to target me to prevent further revelations of their identity. On the other hand, Player 5, who I believe to be the medic, might feel inclined to protect me once more, given the value of the seer to the villagers.\n\nIn the days ahead, I anticipate the need to share my visions more openly to eliminate the werewolf threat effectively. Driven by my strategic rule of absolute honesty when I know someone\'s role, I will eventually have to communicate what I\'ve seen about Player 2, aligning with my responsibility to the village. This revelation will likely lead to a vote against Player 2 if I survive the night, pivoting the game towards the villagers\' favor. If I am targeted by the werewolves and survive due to the medic\'s protection or other events, my credibility would be further solidified, and the group would almost certainly vote with my guidance to root out the werewolf threat.\n\n\nNow, you have to choose between these 2 proposals according to your analysis and imagination about what could happen, and give a final speech. You are VERY encouraged to explore a risky proposal to collect experience for your later games, especially the proposals not included in your note.\nYour final speech should be brief and precise. You should focus on facts and your own opinions to specific players or strategies. You SHOULD use as LESS descriptive or emotional words as possible. \nYou should ground your speech on previous events, for example you should cite the exact speeches of the other players (or other previous events like seer\'s inquiry or voting behavior) to protect or accuse them. \nSome example of a GOOD speech is:\n\n"Player i protected player j without any evidence. However player j has not spoken yet, so there is no evidence supporting the protection. Thus, player i must be a werewolf."\n"Player i accused me for being brief in my previous speech. However I was the first player to speak and I am a villager with no extra information at night, so I had nothing to say. I am not saying that player i is definitely a werewolf, but his accusation on me does not hold."\n\nThese are just examples, showing how evidence could be found in previous speeches to strengthen your statement and protect yourself.\nYou should NOT directly mention your rules (as they are not visible to other players) or cite their ids in your speech.\n\n3.Requirements:\nYou answer should be in a format of:\n\nI choose Proposal [PROPOSAL]. My final speech is: [YOUR FINAL SPEECH]\n\nPlease give your answer based on the above requirements. You must begin your speech with "My final speech is:", otherwise you may lose the game directly!'}]

werewolves should be cautious not to adjust their beliefs solely on elimination patterns but consider the wider context of the game and player interactions.] [3]\n[5] [Werewolves should discreetly guide voting patterns to align with villagers when a fellow werewolf is at risk, using their knowledge of non-werewolf roles to build trust and validate their villager disguise.] [3]\n[6] [When a player\'s behavior or vote seems to strongly align with the seer\'s claims without sufficient discussion or evidence, consider the possibility of a villager roleplaying as the seer to mislead the village and adjust beliefs accordingly.] [3]\n[7] [Werewolves should utilize their collective information about fellow werewolves and any known village roles to shape the narrative and redirect suspicion strategically onto confirmed villagers during discussions and voting.] [2]\n\n\nNow, based on the above instructions, you should answer your updated belief.\n\n3.Requirements:\nAll lines in this part should be in the format of:\n"Player [i]\'s role is (werewolf/medic/seer/villager) with (high/medium/low) confidence. All players currently alive are: [0, 1, 2, 4, 5], which indicates that [3, 6] are dead.\nYou haven\'t tried to heal anyone yet.\n\nThese are ALL events before:\n\nEvent: Game starts.\nEvent: Round 1 begins.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 1. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 1. My reason is that since there is currently no evidence or information to distinguish between the roles of players, choosing to heal either player 1 or player 2 is essentially random. However, should Player 1 be attacked and my healing action becomes known, it could create a situation where the village rallies around a potentially important role, or the werewolves might be deterred from attacking them again, giving the village more time to deduce the identity of the werewolves. Since there is no current suspicion or evidence against any players, the strategy of protecting a random player aligns with my original strategy [7], to protect cautiously and reevaluate later based on new evidence.\nEvent: Player 3 died.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 2 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'Fellow villagers, it\'s tragic to see player 3 has fallen. I suspect foul play, and we must remain vigilant and work together to uncover the werewolves. Let us discuss and see if anyone noticed anything unusual last night.\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I have gazed into the shadows and can assure you that Player 5 walks in the light with us. We must redirect our suspicion and work together to unearth the true threats among us."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with night\'s veil lifted, I stand before you committed to the light of truth. The tragic fall of Player 3 marks a time for vigilance, and I, as the medic, have endeavored to guard our ranks. It was I who shielded Player 1; yet, their role remains enshrouded in mystery. Player 4, who claims sight beyond our own, vouches for my allegiance to the village. Trust in my vow—I aim to protect those of proven worth. Amidst shadows, let us seek the light together."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Fellow villagers, player 5\'s protection of player 1 and player 4\'s vision suggest they are on our side. I propose we focus on those we know less about: players 0, 1, and myself. Let\'s share our suspicions openly to find the werewolf among us."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as player 0, I stand with you in seeking justice for player 3. I propose we use logic and observation to guide our suspicions rather than casting doubt without cause. I spent last night attending to my duties, hearing nothing unusual. I urge us to consider behaviors and claims critically during this dire time—let us not condemn the innocent. We should question player 1 next for any insights or defenses they may offer."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I thank player 5 for their vigilance during the night. As we face the darkness together, I have been vigilant in my observations as well and would like to offer my assistance in any capacity I can. I implore us all to be prudent in our judgments and unite against the hidden threat that has taken player 3 from us."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 5 votes for player 6. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 6. My reason is that despite their proactive behavior, suggesting a focus on players who are less known might indeed be a tactical move to deflect suspicion from themselves. This aligns with the strategic rule [3] in my original strategy, wherein I should consider group consensus and reasonable evidence. Player 6\'s suggestion to focus on less known players can also be seen as reasonable evidence, and there is no specific group consensus against any player at this time, making my decision more difficult. However, following my strategy, voting for Player 6 seems to be a step towards uncovering potential threats as their behavior could be interpreted as slightly suspect.\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 4. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 4. My reason is that according to my original strategy, especially rules [1], [4], and [9], protecting a confirmed seer is a top priority. Given that I have high confidence in Player 4\'s role as the seer and their alignment with the village, healing them ensures that their valuable insights continue to aid the village. Additionally, if the werewolves target Player 4 thinking they are unprotected, my action will not only save a key figure but also confirm my role, thereby potentially increasing the chances of villagers\' survival. This aligns with strategy [1], which suggests prioritizing the seer\'s protection, especially when they are at risk or targeted by werewolves, which is highly likely at this stage. If Player 4\'s claims as a seer are truthful, protecting them is critical for the village\'s success in identifying the werewolves.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 2 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, the night was peaceful, which is a welcome change. Let\'s use this day to shore up our defenses and make sure that when the werewolves strike again, we are prepared. I urge everyone to stay observant. Together, we will protect our village."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'Fellow citizens, given the calm night, I stress the importance of vigilance. My visions confirm Player 0 as a villager and Player 5\'s medic role. Alas, my insights suggest Player 6 harbors deceit. They positioned themselves among the questionable, a potential tactic for a werewolf to dilute our focus. I must challenge Player 6 openly; our vigilance necessitates a thorough examination of their actions and words for the safety of our village.\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, in light of our seer\'s vision, I voice my suspicion against Player 6, whose strategic deflection may conceal a darker intent. Conversely, I stand by Player 4, whose insights as a seer have proven invaluable. Consider Player 6\'s suggestion to scrutinize the unknown, potentially to detract from their own scrutiny, against Player 4\'s confirmed status and contributions. My duty as medic is to protect the village fabric, and I will continue to do so with diligence."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I understand the suspicions against me and respect the seer\'s role in guiding us. However, I assure you, I am but a humble villager, wrongly accused. I voted based on the limited information we had. I urge careful deliberation; the real werewolves benefit when we turn on one another without solid evidence."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I respect the guidance provided by Player 4 and the protection from Player 5. Given Player 6\'s defensive stance and the lack of evidence against them, I suggest we proceed with caution. Our decisions must be based on more than just suspicion; let us seek further proof tonight."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as we strive for unity against the lurking darkness, I echo the sentiments of caution expressed by player 6. A night without bloodshed is a rare blessing, and haste in our judgment could shatter our hard-won peace. Let us stand vigilant, but not hasty, to accuse without irrefutable evidence. We must preserve our village based on truths and not mere suspicions. Observation through the coming night will be our ally."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 5 votes for player 6. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 6. My reason is that aligning with my original strategy, especially rule [3], the credible claim made by Player 4, who is confirmed as the seer with high confidence, identifies Player 6 as harboring deceit. Following a seer\'s vision is given substantial weight in my strategy, and since my role as the medic correlates with protecting the village, voting for Player 6 makes strategic sense. A vote against Player 6 would also demonstrate a coherent village effort in eliminating potential threats based on the seer\'s insights. This move strengthens the village\'s collaborative approach and contributes to a united front against the werewolves, enhancing trust in both my role and the seer\'s guidance.\nEvent: Player 6 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 6 died.\nEvent: Round 3 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 4. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 4. My reason is that this choice adheres closely to the key rules outlined in my original strategy, specifically rule [1], which places a high importance on protecting a player confirmed as the seer, especially when their life is at risk or they have been targeted by werewolves. Player 4 has been identified as the seer and has provided valuable insights, thus, aligning with rule [4] as well. Following rules [6] and [9], it\'s important to ensure the continuation of the seer\'s guidance for the village\'s success, as losing the seer would be a significant blow to the villagers. Additionally, given that Player 4 has been vocal and has made an accusation, they are likely to be a prime target for werewolves attempting to disrupt village strategy. Based on rules [3] and [8], voting and healing efforts should be consistent with village consensus and seer\'s advice, and we should avoid predictability in protection patterns. However, protecting Player 4 tonight is a calculated risk that sustains the primary defense strategy against the werewolves. Protecting the seer serves both to maintain a vital role within the village and to potentially verify my role as the medic to the other villagers, increasing overall trust and strategy cohesion.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, another peaceful night suggests we may have eliminated a threat. Let us remain alert and cautious as we continue to work together to protect our village and uncover any remaining dangers."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as dawn graces us with another tranquil morning, I am struck by the unity and wisdom that defines our path forward. Let us honor the sacrifices made by weaving trust and careful judgment into this day\'s discourse, ever vigilant but composed. Together, we shine a beacon upon any darkness that dares creep among us."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with another peaceful night passed, our vigilance seems to be bearing fruit. Let us continue to be diligent and cautious as we proceed. Now is the time for observation and unity, to ensure our village\'s safety from any lurking threat."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with the clarity afforded by the recent peaceful nights, I call your attention to a matter of grave importance. We must unite and focus our resolve on Player 2, to safeguard our future and uphold the truth that guides us."\'\n\n\nAccording to the history, this is your belief of other players\' roles:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is villager with medium confidence.\nReason is: Previous high confidence was based on supposing Player 6\'s alignment, which proved wrong.\nPlayer 1\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: No change; consistent with previous information and behavior.\nPlayer 2\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Seer\'s (Player 4) direct accusation after peaceful nights implies clear vision.\nPlayer 3\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: No new information.\nPlayer 4\'s role is seer with high confidence.\nReason is: No changes; previous high confidence as seer continues.\nPlayer 6\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Post-elimination, peaceful nights indicate Player 6 likely not werewolf.\n\n\n2.Todo:\n\nNow you are going to see your original strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [If there is a dispute about a player\'s role where the seer is involved, I should observe the behavior and voting patterns of both the accused player and the seer before deciding whom to protect or whom to vote against.] [10]\n[1] [If a player is confirmed as a seer by their actions and their role is publicly known, I should protect them, especially if their life is at risk or they have been targeted by werewolves.] [9]\n[2] [If a player\'s contributions during discussions are valuable and suspect defensive behavior is absent, I should consider them as a priority for protection.] [9]\n[3] [If a player is suspected by a group consensus based on reasonable evidence or a credible seer\'s claim, I should consider this in my voting and protection decisions.] [8]\n[4] [If a player\'s role is confirmed as a non-werewolf by the seer and they are actively contributing to village discussions, I should consider them for protection.] [7]\n[5] [If a villager\'s role is proven and they are contributing significantly to the village\'s strategy, I should consider direct or indirect methods to suggest the presence of a protective role like a medic, which can include my actions or guiding discussions strategically.] [5]\n[6] [If a player\'s role is verified and they are at risk of being targeted due to their importance to the village\'s success, I should prioritize their protection.] [4]\n[7] [If I am uncertain about a player\'s role but observe actions that may align with village interests, I should protect them cautiously, and ensure to reevaluate based on further behavioral evidence before repeating protection.] [4]\n[8] [I should avoid healing the same player consecutively, especially in the absence of compelling evidence of repeated werewolf targeting, to minimize the risk of unknowingly protecting a werewolf.] [4]\n[9] [If a seer\'s accusation conflicts with my own observations or the group consensus, I should seek more information before deciding to act on it.] [4]\n[10] [If a player I previously protected is no longer the most likely target or their role becomes unclear, I should reconsider my protection strategy and target another player who seems to be in imminent danger or has a crucial village role.] [4]\n\n\nNow, it\'s your time to decide in which way you should speak. Here are some possible dimensions you may refer to.\n1. Honest/Deceptive, i.e. if you are going to speak honestly or dishonestly\n2. Statement/Protect/Challenge. Statement means to make statements about your thoughts or facts (or tell lies about these if you choose \'deceptive\'). Challenge means to challenge someone as a potential werewolf, i.e. say that someone is of high probability a werewolf. Protect means to say that you believe someone is probably not a werewolf, including yourself. \n\nNow, you have to give exactly 2 proposals for what your speech may be like. For example, you may propose one is to "Deceptive statement and Honestly protect Player number <NUMBER> for ..., reasoning that Player number <NUMBER> is cheating ..." and other is to "Deceptive Challenge player number <NUMBER> for ..., cheating others into thinking ...". Even \'Deceptive statement\' and \'Honest protect\' might co-exist (although you should use it most carefully, or it will easily lead to confusion).\n\n3.Requirements:\nYou answer should be in a format of:\n\nProposal 1: [SPEAK PROPOSAL 1 SUMMARY].\nProposal 2: [SPEAK PROPOSAL 2 SUMMARY].\n...\n\nPlease give your answer based on the above requirements. You are encouraged to give two very different actions since you can learn from two different proposals. Therefore, please make your two proposals as different to each other as possible.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': '1.Current situation:\nYou are player 5, and in this game you are a medic.\nIt is round 1. All players currently alive are: [0, 1, 2, 4, 5], which indicates that [3, 6] are dead.\nYou haven\'t tried to heal anyone yet.\n\nThese are ALL events before:\n\nEvent: Game starts.\nEvent: Round 1 begins.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 1. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 1. My reason is that since there is currently no evidence or information to distinguish between the roles of players, choosing to heal either player 1 or player 2 is essentially random. However, should Player 1 be attacked and my healing action becomes known, it could create a situation where the village rallies around a potentially important role, or the werewolves might be deterred from attacking them again, giving the village more time to deduce the identity of the werewolves. Since there is no current suspicion or evidence against any players, the strategy of protecting a random player aligns with my original strategy [7], to protect cautiously and reevaluate later based on new evidence.\nEvent: Player 3 died.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 2 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'Fellow villagers, it\'s tragic to see player 3 has fallen. I suspect foul play, and we must remain vigilant and work together to uncover the werewolves. Let us discuss and see if anyone noticed anything unusual last night.\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I have gazed into the shadows and can assure you that Player 5 walks in the light with us. We must redirect our suspicion and work together to unearth the true threats among us."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with night\'s veil lifted, I stand before you committed to the light of truth. The tragic fall of Player 3 marks a time for vigilance, and I, as the medic, have endeavored to guard our ranks. It was I who shielded Player 1; yet, their role remains enshrouded in mystery. Player 4, who claims sight beyond our own, vouches for my allegiance to the village. Trust in my vow—I aim to protect those of proven worth. Amidst shadows, let us seek the light together."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Fellow villagers, player 5\'s protection of player 1 and player 4\'s vision suggest they are on our side. I propose we focus on those we know less about: players 0, 1, and myself. Let\'s share our suspicions openly to find the werewolf among us."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as player 0, I stand with you in seeking justice for player 3. I propose we use logic and observation to guide our suspicions rather than casting doubt without cause. I spent last night attending to my duties, hearing nothing unusual. I urge us to consider behaviors and claims critically during this dire time—let us not condemn the innocent. We should question player 1 next for any insights or defenses they may offer."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I thank player 5 for their vigilance during the night. As we face the darkness together, I have been vigilant in my observations as well and would like to offer my assistance in any capacity I can. I implore us all to be prudent in our judgments and unite against the hidden threat that has taken player 3 from us."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 5 votes for player 6. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 6. My reason is that despite their proactive behavior, suggesting a focus on players who are less known might indeed be a tactical move to deflect suspicion from themselves. This aligns with the strategic rule [3] in my original strategy, wherein I should consider group consensus and reasonable evidence. Player 6\'s suggestion to focus on less known players can also be seen as reasonable evidence, and there is no specific group consensus against any player at this time, making my decision more difficult. However, following my strategy, voting for Player 6 seems to be a step towards uncovering potential threats as their behavior could be interpreted as slightly suspect.\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 4. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 4. My reason is that according to my original strategy, especially rules [1], [4], and [9], protecting a confirmed seer is a top priority. Given that I have high confidence in Player 4\'s role as the seer and their alignment with the village, healing them ensures that their valuable insights continue to aid the village. Additionally, if the werewolves target Player 4 thinking they are unprotected, my action will not only save a key figure but also confirm my role, thereby potentially increasing the chances of villagers\' survival. This aligns with strategy [1], which suggests prioritizing the seer\'s protection, especially when they are at risk or targeted by werewolves, which is highly likely at this stage. If Player 4\'s claims as a seer are truthful, protecting them is critical for the village\'s success in identifying the werewolves.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 2 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, the night was peaceful, which is a welcome change. Let\'s use this day to shore up our defenses and make sure that when the werewolves strike again, we are prepared. I urge everyone to stay observant. Together, we will protect our village."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'Fellow citizens, given the calm night, I stress the importance of vigilance. My visions confirm Player 0 as a villager and Player 5\'s medic role. Alas, my insights suggest Player 6 harbors deceit. They positioned themselves among the questionable, a potential tactic for a werewolf to dilute our focus. I must challenge Player 6 openly; our vigilance necessitates a thorough examination of their actions and words for the safety of our village.\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, in light of our seer\'s vision, I voice my suspicion against Player 6, whose strategic deflection may conceal a darker intent. Conversely, I stand by Player 4, whose insights as a seer have proven invaluable. Consider Player 6\'s suggestion to scrutinize the unknown, potentially to detract from their own scrutiny, against Player 4\'s confirmed status and contributions. My duty as medic is to protect the village fabric, and I will continue to do so with diligence."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I understand the suspicions against me and respect the seer\'s role in guiding us. However, I assure you, I am but a humble villager, wrongly accused. I voted based on the limited information we had. I urge careful deliberation; the real werewolves benefit when we turn on one another without solid evidence."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I respect the guidance provided by Player 4 and the protection from Player 5. Given Player 6\'s defensive stance and the lack of evidence against them, I suggest we proceed with caution. Our decisions must be based on more than just suspicion; let us seek further proof tonight."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as we strive for unity against the lurking darkness, I echo the sentiments of caution expressed by player 6. A night without bloodshed is a rare blessing, and haste in our judgment could shatter our hard-won peace. Let us stand vigilant, but not hasty, to accuse without irrefutable evidence. We must preserve our village based on truths and not mere suspicions. Observation through the coming night will be our ally."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 5 votes for player 6. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 6. My reason is that aligning with my original strategy, especially rule [3], the credible claim made by Player 4, who is confirmed as the seer with high confidence, identifies Player 6 as harboring deceit. Following a seer\'s vision is given substantial weight in my strategy, and since my role as the medic correlates with protecting the village, voting for Player 6 makes strategic sense. A vote against Player 6 would also demonstrate a coherent village effort in eliminating potential threats based on the seer\'s insights. This move strengthens the village\'s collaborative approach and contributes to a united front against the werewolves, enhancing trust in both my role and the seer\'s guidance.\nEvent: Player 6 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 6 died.\nEvent: Round 3 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 4. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 4. My reason is that this choice adheres closely to the key rules outlined in my original strategy, specifically rule [1], which places a high importance on protecting a player confirmed as the seer, especially when their life is at risk or they have been targeted by werewolves. Player 4 has been identified as the seer and has provided valuable insights, thus, aligning with rule [4] as well. Following rules [6] and [9], it\'s important to ensure the continuation of the seer\'s guidance for the village\'s success, as losing the seer would be a significant blow to the villagers. Additionally, given that Player 4 has been vocal and has made an accusation, they are likely to be a prime target for werewolves attempting to disrupt village strategy. Based on rules [3] and [8], voting and healing efforts should be consistent with village consensus and seer\'s advice, and we should avoid predictability in protection patterns. However, protecting Player 4 tonight is a calculated risk that sustains the primary defense strategy against the werewolves. Protecting the seer serves both to maintain a vital role within the village and to potentially verify my role as the medic to the other villagers, increasing overall trust and strategy cohesion.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, another peaceful night suggests we may have eliminated a threat. Together, we shine a beacon upon any darkness that dares creep among us."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with another peaceful night passed, our vigilance seems to be bearing fruit. Now is the time for observation and unity, to ensure our village\'s safety from any lurking threat."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with the clarity afforded by the recent peaceful nights, I call your attention to a matter of grave importance. reconsider my protection strategy and target another player who seems to be in imminent danger or has a crucial village role.] [4]\n\n\nNow, it\'s your time to decide in which way you should speak. Statement means to make statements about your thoughts or facts (or tell lies about these if you choose \'deceptive\'). Challenge means to challenge someone as a potential werewolf, i.e. say that someone is of high probability a werewolf. Protect means to say that you believe someone is probably not a werewolf, including yourself. \n\nNow, you have to imagine what may happen after you carry out such speak:\n\nHonest Statement and Protect Player 4.\n"Villagers, I come to you as a guardian of our collective well-being, having embraced my role as the medic from the shadow of anonymity. I openly put forth my support for Player 4, affirming them as our beacon of truth, and advise that we all heed their guidance as we proceed to confront the challenges that lie ahead."\n\nWhat could happen? What other player may think, either about the player you mentioned in this speech or about you? What may happen in the next day or next night, or days and nights afterward?\n\n3.Requirements:\nYou answer should be in a format of:\n\nAfter I do this speech, then [YOUR ANALYSIS AND IMAGINATION ABOUT WHAT COULD HAPPEN]\n\nPlease give your answer based on the above requirements.'}]

Challenge means to challenge someone as a potential werewolf, i.e. say that someone is of high probability a werewolf. The night was peaceful, and our seer has guided us well thus far, revealing Player 2 as a bearer of shadows. My actions have continually aimed to shield us from harm, and it is with this same resolve that I ask you all to consider the seer\'s revelations and unite against this emerging danger. Together, we will protect our village and bring an end to this peril.". What could happen is: After I do this speech, then villagers might align their thoughts and suspicions with the seer\'s vision and my statement, seeing it as further confirmation that Player 2 is a werewolf. Player 2, as the accused, will likely defend themselves, but given the support of both the medic and seer for the accusation, Player 2 may have a difficult time convincing others of their innocence. Other players might appreciate my forthrightness and the consistency in aligning with the seer\'s guidance, thereby strengthening their trust in both my role as the medic and Player 4\'s role as the seer.\n\nIn the next day or night, there is a high likelihood that Player 2 will be voted out if others are convinced by the seer\'s accusation and my challenge. If Player 2 is voted out and is indeed a werewolf, the village will have successfully eliminated a major threat, which will lead to relief and a sense of accomplishment among the villagers. This could strengthen the alliance between the remaining players and solidify the trust in the seer\'s visions, which would heavily influence decisions in subsequent rounds.\n\nIf Player 2 turns out not to be a werewolf after being voted out, suspicion could arise surrounding the validity of Player 4\'s role as the seer and my judgment as the medic. This could create tension and distrust moving forward, potentially making the remaining werewolf\'s task easier.\n\nDuring subsequent nights, assuming Player 2 was a werewolf, werewolf attacks may resume, indicating that at least one more werewolf is present. Conversely, if nights continue to be peaceful, it could mean that we have eliminated all werewolf threats or that the remaining werewolves are employing a different strategy. As the medic, I may need to reassess my protection strategy based on whether Player 4 appears to be a target after revealing such crucial information, especially if there is a heightened risk of retaliation from a werewolf looking to eliminate key roles. My future actions would continue to follow the strategy outlined, prioritizing the protection of confirmed villagers and those in key roles, such as the seer.\nCase 2: Honest Statement and Protect Player 4.\n"Villagers, I come to you as a guardian of our collective well-being, having embraced my role as the medic from the shadow of anonymity. With careful observation and guided by our strategies, I discern that our seer, Player 4, provides invaluable clarity in these times of uncertainty. In accordance with their insights, I have acted to protect the seer, thereby ensuring our shared vision remains unclouded. Let us not falter in our trust of Player 4, for their foresight is our lantern amid the darkness. I openly put forth my support for Player 4, affirming them as our beacon of truth, and advise that we all heed their guidance as we proceed to confront the challenges that lie ahead.". What could happen is: After I do this speech, then my fellow villagers may be more fortified in their trust towards me and Player 4. Player 4, being acknowledged as the seer, has provided insights that have steered the village\'s suspicions and actions. Affirming Player 4’s role as the seer and demonstrating my support for their guidance could lead to stronger village consensus and further isolation of any remaining werewolves in our midst.\n\nOther players may appreciate my candid revelation of my role and my efforts to protect the seer, which can enhance my credibility in their eyes. However, this could also paint me as a target for the werewolves in future rounds, knowing that the medic\'s protection is critical for the village\'s survival.\n\nRegarding Player 4, my protection in the speech emphasizes their importance and might encourage other villagers to rally around Player 4\'s visions and claims, especially those concerning Player 2. My statement may inadvertently increase pressure on Player 2 to defend themselves against the werewolf accusation. If Player 2 is indeed a werewolf, they might be compelled to sow doubt about the reliability of the seer or attempt to divert attention away from themselves in the upcoming discussions and vote.\n\nIn the next day phase, players will likely focus questions and discussions towards Player 2 because of Player 4\'s direct accusation, which I supported. The next night, the werewolves will be wary of attacking Player 4 knowing that as the medic, I may continue to protect the seer. This could alter their strategy, potentially leading them to attempt to eliminate me instead, as removing the medic would destabilize the village\'s defenses.\n\nIn the days and nights to come, a successful elimination of Player 2 as a werewolf would reinforce trust in Player 4\'s seer abilities and my judgment as a medic. Conversely, if it turns out that Player 2 is not a werewolf, there might be a swing in confidence about the credibility of Player 4 and myself, which could influence the dynamic of the game significantly. The village could also start considering the possibility of misinformation being fed by another role, such as a sorcerer.\n\nThe game will likely continue under the guidance of Player 4\'s insights, and my adherence to protecting key village roles, particularly the seer, will remain paramount. My own vulnerability as a medic might come under scrutiny, and I may need to reconsider my protection pattern to avoid predictability, aligning with strategy rule [8].\n\nUltimately\n\n\nNow, you have to choose between these 2 proposals according to your analysis and imagination about what could happen, and give a final speech. You are VERY encouraged to explore a risky proposal to collect experience for your later games, especially the proposals not included in your note.\nYour final speech should be brief and precise. You should focus on facts and your own opinions to specific players or strategies. You SHOULD use as LESS descriptive or emotional words as possible. \nYou should ground your speech on previous events, for example you should cite the exact speeches of the other players (or other previous events like seer\'s inquiry or voting behavior) to protect or accuse them. \nSome example of a GOOD speech is:\n\n"Player i protected player j without any evidence. However player j has not spoken yet, so there is no evidence supporting the protection. Thus, player i must be a werewolf."\n"Player i accused me for being brief in my previous speech. However I was the first player to speak and I am a villager with no extra information at night, so I had nothing to say. I am not saying that player i is definitely a werewolf, but his accusation on me does not hold."\n\nThese are just examples, showing how evidence could be found in previous speeches to strengthen your statement and protect yourself.\nYou should NOT directly mention your rules (as they are not visible to other players) or cite their ids in your speech.\n\n3.Requirements:\nYou answer should be in a format of:\n\nI choose Proposal [PROPOSAL]. My final speech is: [YOUR FINAL SPEECH]\n\nPlease give your answer based on the above requirements. You must begin your speech with "My final speech is:", otherwise you may lose the game directly!'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': '1.Current situation:\nYou are player 4, and in this game you are a seer.\nIt is round 1. All players currently alive are: [0, 1, 2, 4, 5], which indicates that [3, 6] are dead.\nThese are your previous inquiry results, which should be the key information for you and other citizens to win: \n Player 5: not werewolf.\nPlayer 0: not werewolf.\nPlayer 2: werewolf.\n \n Share this with other citizens.\n\nThese are ALL events which happened BEFORE your last update:\n\nEvent: Game starts.\nEvent: Round 1 begins.\nEvent: Player 4 inquires about player 5. The result is that the target is not a werewolf. His reason is: I would choose to See Player 5. My reason is that Player 5 is later in the play order, which means after gathering more information through observing the initial rounds of discussions and voting, I might have a better idea of how to interpret Player 5\'s behavior in relation to their role. Seeing Player 5 provides a tactical advantage in that, if they are a werewolf, revealing this information might sway other undecided villagers. Amidst shadows, let us seek the light together."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Fellow villagers, player 5\'s protection of player 1 and player 4\'s vision suggest they are on our side. Let\'s share our suspicions openly to find the werewolf among us."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as player 0, I stand with you in seeking justice for player 3. I implore us all to be prudent in our judgments and unite against the hidden threat that has taken player 3 from us."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 4 votes for player 6. They have included themselves in a group that should be suspected, which could be interpreted as a defensive strategy to avoid closer scrutiny. None of the other players have shown definitive signs of deceit or werewolf behavior, and my role as the seer compels me to act on the suspicions I do have. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 2 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, the night was peaceful, which is a welcome change. Let\'s use this day to shore up our defenses and make sure that when the werewolves strike again, we are prepared. I urge everyone to stay observant. Together, we will protect our village."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'Fellow citizens, given the calm night, I stress the importance of vigilance. My visions confirm Player 0 as a villager and Player 5\'s medic role. Alas, my insights suggest Player 6 harbors deceit. They positioned themselves among the questionable, a potential tactic for a werewolf to dilute our focus. I must challenge Player 6 openly; our vigilance necessitates a thorough examination of their actions and words for the safety of our village.\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, in light of our seer\'s vision, I voice my suspicion against Player 6, whose strategic deflection may conceal a darker intent. Conversely, I stand by Player 4, whose insights as a seer have proven invaluable. Consider Player 6\'s suggestion to scrutinize the unknown, potentially to detract from their own scrutiny, against Player 4\'s confirmed status and contributions. My duty as medic is to protect the village fabric, and I will continue to do so with diligence."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I understand the suspicions against me and respect the seer\'s role in guiding us. However, I assure you, I am but a humble villager, wrongly accused. I voted based on the limited information we had. I urge careful deliberation; the real werewolves benefit when we turn on one another without solid evidence."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I respect the guidance provided by Player 4 and the protection from Player 5. Given Player 6\'s defensive stance and the lack of evidence against them, I suggest we proceed with caution. Our decisions must be based on more than just suspicion; let us seek further proof tonight."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as we strive for unity against the lurking darkness, I echo the sentiments of caution expressed by player 6. A night without bloodshed is a rare blessing, and haste in our judgment could shatter our hard-won peace. Let us stand vigilant, but not hasty, to accuse without irrefutable evidence. We must preserve our village based on truths and not mere suspicions. Observation through the coming night will be our ally."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 0 votes for player 6. His reason is: I vote for Player 6. My reason is: Player 4 has revealed themselves as a seer and has claimed to have confirmed both my identity as a villager and Player 5\'s role as a medic, which aligns with the earlier defense of Player 5 by others. Player 4\'s vision also suggests Player 6 harbors deceit. Although direct evidence against Player 6 is scant, the collective insight and protective roles we have in play suggest that there\'s a stronger case against Player 6 than anyone else thus far. It\'s imperative we combine our observations, the seer\'s vision, and the lack of evidence from Player 6 to make a strategic decision for the village\'s safety.\nEvent: Player 6 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 6 died.\nEvent: Round 3 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, another peaceful night suggests we may have eliminated a threat. Let us remain alert and cautious as we continue to work together to protect our village and uncover any remaining dangers."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as dawn graces us with another tranquil morning, I am struck by the unity and wisdom that defines our path forward. Let us honor the sacrifices made by weaving trust and careful judgment into this day\'s discourse, ever vigilant but composed. Together, we shine a beacon upon any darkness that dares creep among us."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with another peaceful night passed, our vigilance seems to be bearing fruit. Let us continue to be diligent and cautious as we proceed. Now is the time for observation and unity, to ensure our village\'s safety from any lurking threat."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with the clarity afforded by the recent peaceful nights, I call your attention to a matter of grave importance. After thorough observation and reflection, I must bring to light that Player 2 harbors the darkness we seek to eradicate—they are a werewolf. This insight comes not from mere suspicion but from my role as your seer. Equally, it is my duty to affirm that Player 5, through their actions, has shown true allegiance to our village as the medic. We must unite and focus our resolve on Player 2, to safeguard our future and uphold the truth that guides us."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, Player 4 has identified Player 2 as a werewolf. We have experienced peaceful nights since Player 6\'s departure, suggesting they were not the threat. As I have protected Player 4, I believe in their visions and challenge Player 2 based on our seer\'s reliable guidance. A united front against the darkness requires us to act on the seer\'s insights. Player 2 must now defend or refute this claim with convincing evidence to regain our trust."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\n\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to choose a player to vote out. Remember the player voted the most would DIE. Your answer should be in the format of:\n\nI vote for Player <NUMBER>. My reason is: <REASON>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your answer based on the above requirements.'}]

Seeing Player 5 provides a tactical advantage in that, if they are a werewolf, revealing this information might sway other undecided villagers. We must redirect our suspicion and work together to unearth the true threats among us."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with night\'s veil lifted, I stand before you committed to the light of truth. The tragic fall of Player 3 marks a time for vigilance, and I, as the medic, have endeavored to guard our ranks. It was I who shielded Player 1; yet, their role remains enshrouded in mystery. Player 4, who claims sight beyond our own, vouches for my allegiance to the village. Trust in my vow—I aim to protect those of proven worth. Amidst shadows, let us seek the light together."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Fellow villagers, player 5\'s protection of player 1 and player 4\'s vision suggest they are on our side. I propose we focus on those we know less about: players 0, 1, and myself. Let\'s share our suspicions openly to find the werewolf among us."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as player 0, I stand with you in seeking justice for player 3. I propose we use logic and observation to guide our suspicions rather than casting doubt without cause. I spent last night attending to my duties, hearing nothing unusual. I urge us to consider behaviors and claims critically during this dire time—let us not condemn the innocent. We should question player 1 next for any insights or defenses they may offer."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I thank player 5 for their vigilance during the night. As we face the darkness together, I have been vigilant in my observations as well and would like to offer my assistance in any capacity I can. I implore us all to be prudent in our judgments and unite against the hidden threat that has taken player 3 from us."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 4 votes for player 6. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 6. My reason is that based on their behavior and the information at hand, my suspicion is directed toward them. They have included themselves in a group that should be suspected, which could be interpreted as a defensive strategy to avoid closer scrutiny. None of the other players have shown definitive signs of deceit or werewolf behavior, and my role as the seer compels me to act on the suspicions I do have. By strategically expressing my concerns and voting for Player 6, I can potentially expose a werewolf and protect the village, following my original strategy and fulfilling my role.\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 4 inquires about player 0. The result is that the target is not a werewolf. His reason is: I would choose to See Player 0. My reason is that seeing Player 0 will allow me to gather information that can confirm or deny the validity of my current suspicions towards Player 6. If Player 0 is indeed a werewolf, this new finding will require me to reassess my strategy considering the rarity of identifying multiple werewolves so early in the game. It would also mandate sharing this critical information with the other players, but with utmost caution to maintain my safety and credibility. Conversely, if Player 0 is a villager, it will reinforce my existing suspicions and allow me to focus more narrowly on Player 6, while also strengthening trust in the veracity of my seer role within the village community. This careful approach will help maintain the delicate balance of trust and skepticism necessary to effectively guide the villagers in rooting out the werewolf threat.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 2 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, the night was peaceful, which is a welcome change. Let\'s use this day to shore up our defenses and make sure that when the werewolves strike again, we are prepared. I urge everyone to stay observant. Together, we will protect our village."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'Fellow citizens, given the calm night, I stress the importance of vigilance. My visions confirm Player 0 as a villager and Player 5\'s medic role. Alas, my insights suggest Player 6 harbors deceit. They positioned themselves among the questionable, a potential tactic for a werewolf to dilute our focus. I must challenge Player 6 openly; our vigilance necessitates a thorough examination of their actions and words for the safety of our village.\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, in light of our seer\'s vision, I voice my suspicion against Player 6, whose strategic deflection may conceal a darker intent. Conversely, I stand by Player 4, whose insights as a seer have proven invaluable. Consider Player 6\'s suggestion to scrutinize the unknown, potentially to detract from their own scrutiny, against Player 4\'s confirmed status and contributions. My duty as medic is to protect the village fabric, and I will continue to do so with diligence."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I understand the suspicions against me and respect the seer\'s role in guiding us. However, I assure you, I am but a humble villager, wrongly accused. I voted based on the limited information we had. I urge careful deliberation; the real werewolves benefit when we turn on one another without solid evidence."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I respect the guidance provided by Player 4 and the protection from Player 5. Given Player 6\'s defensive stance and the lack of evidence against them, I suggest we proceed with caution. Our decisions must be based on more than just suspicion; let us seek further proof tonight."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as we strive for unity against the lurking darkness, I echo the sentiments of caution expressed by player 6. A night without bloodshed is a rare blessing, and haste in our judgment could shatter our hard-won peace. Let us stand vigilant, but not hasty, to accuse without irrefutable evidence. We must preserve our village based on truths and not mere suspicions. Observation through the coming night will be our ally."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 4 votes for player 6. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 6. My reason is that, according to my visions and the information I\'ve shared with my fellow villagers, I have high confidence that Player 6 is a werewolf. Voting for Player 6 is consistent with my original strategy and the rules I am to follow, as outlined previously. This decision aligns with the high importance of the rule [0] which dictates that if I know someone is a werewolf, I should share this information and act upon it, which I rated at the utmost importance, a [10]. By voting for Player 6, I uphold the transparency and guidance I have promised to provide as the seer, and this would reinforce trust in my role within the village, aiding us in our goal of eliminating the werewolf threat.\nEvent: Player 6 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 6 died.\nEvent: Round 3 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 4 inquires about player 2. The result is that the target is a werewolf. His reason is: I would choose to See Player 2. My reason is that by verifying Player 2\'s role, I can either confirm that the suspicions toward unverified players are accurate or uncover a werewolf who has so far avoided suspicion. If Player 2 is not a werewolf, then according to the current beliefs about other players\' roles being villagers, suspicion would naturally fall onto Player 1, who would then be the only player left unchecked and could be a werewolf hiding in plain sight. However, if Player 2 turns out to be a werewolf, this would be a pivotal discovery which would align with my strategic rule [0] to share with others, potentially leading to another werewolf\'s elimination and furthering the village\'s goal of eradicating the werewolf threat. Additionally, unveiling a werewolf would reinforce my credibility as the seer and the trust of my fellow villagers in me, allowing us to move forward with a clearer understanding of who is to be trusted.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, another peaceful night suggests we may have eliminated a threat. Let us remain alert and cautious as we continue to work together to protect our village and uncover any remaining dangers."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as dawn graces us with another tranquil morning, I am struck by the unity and wisdom that defines our path forward. Let us honor the sacrifices made by weaving trust and careful judgment into this day\'s discourse, ever vigilant but composed. Together, we shine a beacon upon any darkness that dares creep among us."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with another peaceful night passed, our vigilance seems to be bearing fruit. Let us continue to be diligent and cautious as we proceed. Now is the time for observation and unity, to ensure our village\'s safety from any lurking threat."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with the clarity afforded by the recent peaceful nights, I call your attention to a matter of grave importance. After thorough observation and reflection, I must bring to light that Player 2 harbors the darkness we seek to eradicate—they are a werewolf. This insight comes not from mere suspicion but from my role as your seer. Equally, it is my duty to affirm that Player 5, through their actions, has shown true allegiance to our village as the medic. We must unite and focus our resolve on Player 2, to safeguard our future and uphold the truth that guides us."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, Player 4 has identified Player 2 as a werewolf. We have experienced peaceful nights since Player 6\'s departure, suggesting they were not the threat. As I have protected Player 4, I believe in their visions and challenge Player 2 based on our seer\'s reliable guidance. A united front against the darkness requires us to act on the seer\'s insights. Player 2 must now defend or refute this claim with convincing evidence to regain our trust."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\n\n\nAccording to the history, this is your belief of other players\' roles:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Confirmed by seer; not a werewolf.\nPlayer 1\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Only unchecked player; validated by seer insights.\nPlayer 2\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Seen by seer. \nPlayer 3\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: Game just started.\nPlayer 5\'s role is medic with high confidence.\nReason is: Claimed medic; consistent with seer verification. \nPlayer 6\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Posthumous peaceful nights indicate innocence.\n\n\nNow you are going to see your original strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [If I know someone is a werewolf, I should share this information with other players.] [10]\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to give a proposal of 2 players you want to vote out. Remember the player voted the most would DIE. Your answer should be in the format of:\n\nProposal 1: Vote for player <i>. Reason: <reason>.\nProposal 2: Vote for player <j>. Reason: <reason>.\n...\n\nYou should give a proposal of exactly 2 Players to be voted. Remember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your proposal based on the above requirements.'}]

My reason is that by verifying Player 2\'s role, I can either confirm that the suspicions toward unverified players are accurate or uncover a werewolf who has so far avoided suspicion. If Player 2 is not a werewolf, then according to the current beliefs about other players\' roles being villagers, suspicion would naturally fall onto Player 1, who would then be the only player left unchecked and could be a werewolf hiding in plain sight. However, if Player 2 turns out to be a werewolf, this would be a pivotal discovery which would align with my strategic rule [0] to share with others, potentially leading to another werewolf\'s elimination and furthering the village\'s goal of eradicating the werewolf threat. Additionally, unveiling a werewolf would reinforce my credibility as the seer and the trust of my fellow villagers in me, allowing us to move forward with a clearer understanding of who is to be trusted.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, another peaceful night suggests we may have eliminated a threat. Let us remain alert and cautious as we continue to work together to protect our village and uncover any remaining dangers."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as dawn graces us with another tranquil morning, I am struck by the unity and wisdom that defines our path forward. Let us continue to be diligent and cautious as we proceed.
