Let us continue to be diligent and cautious as we proceed. Now is the time for observation and unity, to ensure our village\'s safety from any lurking threat."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with the clarity afforded by the recent peaceful nights, I call your attention to a matter of grave importance. After thorough observation and reflection, I must bring to light that Player 2 harbors the darkness we seek to eradicate—they are a werewolf. This insight comes not from mere suspicion but from my role as your seer. Equally, it is my duty to affirm that Player 5, through their actions, has shown true allegiance to our village as the medic. We must unite and focus our resolve on Player 2, to safeguard our future and uphold the truth that guides us."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, Player 4 has identified Player 2 as a werewolf. We have experienced peaceful nights since Player 6\'s departure, suggesting they were not the threat. As I have protected Player 4, I believe in their visions and challenge Player 2 based on our seer\'s reliable guidance. A united front against the darkness requires us to act on the seer\'s insights. Player 2 must now defend or refute this claim with convincing evidence to regain our trust."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\n\n\nAccording to the history, this is your belief of other players\' roles:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is villager with medium confidence.\nReason is: Previous high confidence was based on supposing Player 6\'s alignment, which proved wrong.\nPlayer 1\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: No change; consistent with previous information and behavior.\nPlayer 2\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Seer\'s (Player 4) high-confidence accusation aligns with rules [2] and [4].\nPlayer 3\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: No new information.\nPlayer 4\'s role is seer with high confidence.\nReason is: No changes; previous high confidence as seer continues.\nPlayer 6\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Post-elimination, peaceful nights indicate Player 6 likely not werewolf.\n\n\nNow you are going to see your original strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [If there is a dispute about a player\'s role where the seer is involved, I should observe the behavior and voting patterns of both the accused player and the seer before deciding whom to protect or whom to vote against.] [10]\n[1] [If a player is confirmed as a seer by their actions and their role is publicly known, I should protect them, especially if their life is at risk or they have been targeted by werewolves.] [9]\n[2] [If a player\'s contributions during discussions are valuable and suspect defensive behavior is absent, I should consider them as a priority for protection.] [9]\n[3] [If a player is suspected by a group consensus based on reasonable evidence or a credible seer\'s claim, I should consider this in my voting and protection decisions.] [8]\n[4] [If a player\'s role is confirmed as a non-werewolf by the seer and they are actively contributing to village discussions, I should consider them for protection.] [7]\n[5] [If a villager\'s role is proven and they are contributing significantly to the village\'s strategy, I should consider direct or indirect methods to suggest the presence of a protective role like a medic, which can include my actions or guiding discussions strategically.] [5]\n[6] [If a player\'s role is verified and they are at risk of being targeted due to their importance to the village\'s success, I should prioritize their protection.] [4]\n[7] [If I am uncertain about a player\'s role but observe actions that may align with village interests, I should protect them cautiously, and ensure to reevaluate based on further behavioral evidence before repeating protection.] [4]\n[8] [I should avoid healing the same player consecutively, especially in the absence of compelling evidence of repeated werewolf targeting, to minimize the risk of unknowingly protecting a werewolf.] [4]\n[9] [If a seer\'s accusation conflicts with my own observations or the group consensus, I should seek more information before deciding to act on it.] [4]\n[10] [If a player I previously protected is no longer the most likely target or their role becomes unclear, I should reconsider my protection strategy and target another player who seems to be in imminent danger or has a crucial village role.] [4]\n\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to give a proposal of 2 players you want to vote out. Remember the player voted the most would DIE. Your answer should be in the format of:\n\nProposal 1: Vote for player <i>. Reason: <reason>.\nProposal 2: Vote for player <j>. Reason: <reason>.\n...\n\nYou should give a proposal of exactly 2 Players to be voted. Remember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your proposal based on the above requirements.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'You are player 5, and in this game you are a medic.\nIt is round 1. All players currently alive are: [0, 1, 2, 4, 5], which indicates that [3, 6] are dead.\nYou haven\'t tried to heal anyone yet.\n\nThese are ALL events before:\n\nEvent: Game starts.\nEvent: Round 1 begins.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 1. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 1. My reason is that since there is currently no evidence or information to distinguish between the roles of players, choosing to heal either player 1 or player 2 is essentially random. However, should Player 1 be attacked and my healing action becomes known, it could create a situation where the village rallies around a potentially important role, or the werewolves might be deterred from attacking them again, giving the village more time to deduce the identity of the werewolves. Since there is no current suspicion or evidence against any players, the strategy of protecting a random player aligns with my original strategy [7], to protect cautiously and reevaluate later based on new evidence.\nEvent: Player 3 died.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 2 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'Fellow villagers, it\'s tragic to see player 3 has fallen. I suspect foul play, and we must remain vigilant and work together to uncover the werewolves. Let us discuss and see if anyone noticed anything unusual last night.\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I have gazed into the shadows and can assure you that Player 5 walks in the light with us. We must redirect our suspicion and work together to unearth the true threats among us."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with night\'s veil lifted, I stand before you committed to the light of truth. The tragic fall of Player 3 marks a time for vigilance, and I, as the medic, have endeavored to guard our ranks. It was I who shielded Player 1; yet, their role remains enshrouded in mystery. Player 4, who claims sight beyond our own, vouches for my allegiance to the village. Trust in my vow—I aim to protect those of proven worth. Amidst shadows, let us seek the light together."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Fellow villagers, player 5\'s protection of player 1 and player 4\'s vision suggest they are on our side. I propose we focus on those we know less about: players 0, 1, and myself. Let\'s share our suspicions openly to find the werewolf among us."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as player 0, I stand with you in seeking justice for player 3. I propose we use logic and observation to guide our suspicions rather than casting doubt without cause. I spent last night attending to my duties, hearing nothing unusual. I urge us to consider behaviors and claims critically during this dire time—let us not condemn the innocent. We should question player 1 next for any insights or defenses they may offer."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I thank player 5 for their vigilance during the night. As we face the darkness together, I have been vigilant in my observations as well and would like to offer my assistance in any capacity I can. I implore us all to be prudent in our judgments and unite against the hidden threat that has taken player 3 from us."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 5 votes for player 6. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 6. My reason is that despite their proactive behavior, suggesting a focus on players who are less known might indeed be a tactical move to deflect suspicion from themselves. This aligns with the strategic rule [3] in my original strategy, wherein I should consider group consensus and reasonable evidence. Player 6\'s suggestion to focus on less known players can also be seen as reasonable evidence, and there is no specific group consensus against any player at this time, making my decision more difficult. However, following my strategy, voting for Player 6 seems to be a step towards uncovering potential threats as their behavior could be interpreted as slightly suspect.\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 4. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 4. My reason is that according to my original strategy, especially rules [1], [4], and [9], protecting a confirmed seer is a top priority. Given that I have high confidence in Player 4\'s role as the seer and their alignment with the village, healing them ensures that their valuable insights continue to aid the village. Additionally, if the werewolves target Player 4 thinking they are unprotected, my action will not only save a key figure but also confirm my role, thereby potentially increasing the chances of villagers\' survival. This aligns with strategy [1], which suggests prioritizing the seer\'s protection, especially when they are at risk or targeted by werewolves, which is highly likely at this stage. If Player 4\'s claims as a seer are truthful, protecting them is critical for the village\'s success in identifying the werewolves.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 2 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, the night was peaceful, which is a welcome change. Let\'s use this day to shore up our defenses and make sure that when the werewolves strike again, we are prepared. I urge everyone to stay observant. Together, we will protect our village."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'Fellow citizens, given the calm night, I stress the importance of vigilance. My visions confirm Player 0 as a villager and Player 5\'s medic role. Alas, my insights suggest Player 6 harbors deceit. They positioned themselves among the questionable, a potential tactic for a werewolf to dilute our focus. I must challenge Player 6 openly; our vigilance necessitates a thorough examination of their actions and words for the safety of our village.\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, in light of our seer\'s vision, I voice my suspicion against Player 6, whose strategic deflection may conceal a darker intent. Conversely, I stand by Player 4, whose insights as a seer have proven invaluable. Consider Player 6\'s suggestion to scrutinize the unknown, potentially to detract from their own scrutiny, against Player 4\'s confirmed status and contributions. My duty as medic is to protect the village fabric, and I will continue to do so with diligence."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I understand the suspicions against me and respect the seer\'s role in guiding us. However, I assure you, I am but a humble villager, wrongly accused. I voted based on the limited information we had. I urge careful deliberation; the real werewolves benefit when we turn on one another without solid evidence."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I respect the guidance provided by Player 4 and the protection from Player 5. Given Player 6\'s defensive stance and the lack of evidence against them, I suggest we proceed with caution. Our decisions must be based on more than just suspicion; let us seek further proof tonight."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as we strive for unity against the lurking darkness, I echo the sentiments of caution expressed by player 6. A night without bloodshed is a rare blessing, and haste in our judgment could shatter our hard-won peace. Let us stand vigilant, but not hasty, to accuse without irrefutable evidence. We must preserve our village based on truths and not mere suspicions. Observation through the coming night will be our ally."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 5 votes for player 6. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 6. My reason is that aligning with my original strategy, especially rule [3], the credible claim made by Player 4, who is confirmed as the seer with high confidence, identifies Player 6 as harboring deceit. Following a seer\'s vision is given substantial weight in my strategy, and since my role as the medic correlates with protecting the village, voting for Player 6 makes strategic sense. A vote against Player 6 would also demonstrate a coherent village effort in eliminating potential threats based on the seer\'s insights. This move strengthens the village\'s collaborative approach and contributes to a united front against the werewolves, enhancing trust in both my role and the seer\'s guidance.\nEvent: Player 6 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 6 died.\nEvent: Round 3 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 4. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 4. My reason is that this choice adheres closely to the key rules outlined in my original strategy, specifically rule [1], which places a high importance on protecting a player confirmed as the seer, especially when their life is at risk or they have been targeted by werewolves. Player 4 has been identified as the seer and has provided valuable insights, thus, aligning with rule [4] as well. Following rules [6] and [9], it\'s important to ensure the continuation of the seer\'s guidance for the village\'s success, as losing the seer would be a significant blow to the villagers. Additionally, given that Player 4 has been vocal and has made an accusation, they are likely to be a prime target for werewolves attempting to disrupt village strategy. Based on rules [3] and [8], voting and healing efforts should be consistent with village consensus and seer\'s advice, and we should avoid predictability in protection patterns. However, protecting Player 4 tonight is a calculated risk that sustains the primary defense strategy against the werewolves. Protecting the seer serves both to maintain a vital role within the village and to potentially verify my role as the medic to the other villagers, increasing overall trust and strategy cohesion.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, another peaceful night suggests we may have eliminated a threat. Let us remain alert and cautious as we continue to work together to protect our village and uncover any remaining dangers."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as dawn graces us with another tranquil morning, I am struck by the unity and wisdom that defines our path forward. Together, we shine a beacon upon any darkness that dares creep among us."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with another peaceful night passed, our vigilance seems to be bearing fruit. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [If there is a dispute about a player\'s role where the seer is involved, I should observe the behavior and voting patterns of both the accused player and the seer before deciding whom to protect or whom to vote against.] [10]\n[1] [If a player is confirmed as a seer by their actions and their role is publicly known, I should protect them, especially if their life is at risk or they have been targeted by werewolves.] [9]\n[2] [If a player\'s contributions during discussions are valuable and suspect defensive behavior is absent, I should consider them as a priority for protection.] [9]\n[3] [If a player is suspected by a group consensus based on reasonable evidence or a credible seer\'s claim, I should consider this in my voting and protection decisions.] [8]\n[4] [If a player\'s role is confirmed as a non-werewolf by the seer and they are actively contributing to village discussions, I should consider them for protection.] [7]\n[5] [If a villager\'s role is proven and they are contributing significantly to the village\'s strategy, I should consider direct or indirect methods to suggest the presence of a protective role like a medic, which can include my actions or guiding discussions strategically.] [5]\n[6] [If a player\'s role is verified and they are at risk of being targeted due to their importance to the village\'s success, I should prioritize their protection.] [4]\n[7] [If I am uncertain about a player\'s role but observe actions that may align with village interests, I should protect them cautiously, and ensure to reevaluate based on further behavioral evidence before repeating protection.] [4]\n[8] [I should avoid healing the same player consecutively, especially in the absence of compelling evidence of repeated werewolf targeting, to minimize the risk of unknowingly protecting a werewolf.] [4]\n[9] [If a seer\'s accusation conflicts with my own observations or the group consensus, I should seek more information before deciding to act on it.] [4]\n[10] [If a player I previously protected is no longer the most likely target or their role becomes unclear, I should reconsider my protection strategy and target another player who seems to be in imminent danger or has a crucial village role.] [4]\n\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to Choose from 2 players to vote. Here is the number of these players and an analysis and imagination about what could happen after you vote for each of these players.\n\nCase 1: Vote for Player 2. What could happen is: After I vote for Player 2, I think these things would happen. According to the strategy provided, my vote is heavily influenced by rules [0] and [3], which emphasize acting on group consensus and credible claims from the seer. Since Player 4, whom I\'m confident is the seer, has identified Player 2 as a werewolf, I would be following the seer\'s guidance as per my strategy. \n\nVoting for Player 2 would likely align with the village\'s current efforts to eliminate the werewolf threat, as indicated by Player 4\'s accusation and my own confidence in Player 4\'s ability as a seer. If Player 2 is indeed a werewolf, successfully voting them out would lead to an increase in the village\'s chances of survival and a confirmation of Player 4\'s reliability. \n\nOther players, seeing my vote for Player 2, would likely trust in my role as the medic, as I am demonstrating consistency with the collective strategy that has been established by the seer\'s revelation. This would reinforce the trust between myself and the other villagers, which is critical for maintaining a united front against the werewolves.\n\nShould Player 2 be voted out and the night that follows results in no deaths, it would provide further evidence that we eliminated a true threat. However, if deaths continue, the village would have to reconsider its strategy and assumptions made about the remaining players. My role as the medic becomes even more crucial in protecting those confirmed as villagers or those whose roles contribute significantly to our survival.\n\nIn conclusion, voting for Player 2 seems to be in line with the strategy set forth, the seer\'s guidance, and the collective goal of the village to eradicate the werewolf threat.\n\n\nNow, please choose to vote for one of these players, and give yoru reason about why you would like to vote for this single player.\n\nAnswer in the following format:\n\nI would choose to vote for Player <NUMBER>. My reason is <REASON>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your proposal based on the above requirements.'}]

Scrutinize if analysis leads to productive outcomes or seems designed to manipulate the village.] [5]\n[5] [A player\'s defense of another player should only increase suspicion when it lacks logical basis or contradicts known facts.] [4]\n[6] [Persistent defense or support of a player who is later revealed as a werewolf should increase suspicion of the defender\'s or supporter\'s role, especially if their defense is not supported by concrete evidence.] [4]\n[7] [Actions that lead to a villager\'s elimination should be critically evaluated, especially if the rationale changes post-elimination, to assess potential werewolf behavior.] [4]\n[8] [Consistent alignment with players who are confirmed as werewolves after their elimination should raise suspicion of the aligning player\'s role, especially if they previously defended or justified the werewolf\'s actions.] [3]\n[9] [When a player\'s voting pattern consistently supports individuals who are accused or suspicious, consider the implications of this behavior in the context of attempting to protect werewolves and increase scrutiny on that player.] [3]\n[10] [Voting for the elimination of a villager after previously supporting them significantly increases suspicion, particularly in the absence of new compelling evidence.] [3]\n[11] [Consider the sequence of events when reassessing trust in a player; players whose actions are contrary to their previous patterns, particularly around pivotal moments such as just before a villager\'s elimination, warrant increased scrutiny.] [3]\n\n\nNow, based on the above instructions, you should answer your updated belief.\n\n3.Requirements:\nAll lines in this part should be in the format of:\n"Player [i]\'s role is (werewolf/medic/seer/villager) with (high/medium/low) confidence. My reason is: [reason]."\nAny line not satisfying this format will not be recognized, including any unrecognized role or confidence. You may skip some players if your belief to him/her maintain unchanged.\nThe reason should be AS SHORT AS POSSIBLE. \nA negative example is: \'Player A did not give enough evidence while challenging that player B is not the seer, and as most players agree with player B\'s seer identity, there is high possibility that he is the true seer. Hence player A might be a werewolf.\'\nWe may convert it into: \'Challenged the well-acknowlegded seer (player B) without enough evidence.\'\nThis is merely an example, but it may guide you on how to make your reason briefer.\n\n4.Example response:\nAn example of your response could be:\n\n\n\nThis is only an example of the response format. All numbers and roles in it are unrelated to your current game. '}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': '1.Current situation:\nYou are player 1, and in this game you are a werewolf. All werewolves including you are [1, 2].\nIt is round 1. I propose we use logic and observation to guide our suspicions rather than casting doubt without cause. I spent last night attending to my duties, hearing nothing unusual. I urge us to consider behaviors and claims critically during this dire time—let us not condemn the innocent. We should question player 1 next for any insights or defenses they may offer."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I thank player 5 for their vigilance during the night. As we face the darkness together, I have been vigilant in my observations as well and would like to offer my assistance in any capacity I can. I implore us all to be prudent in our judgments and unite against the hidden threat that has taken player 3 from us."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 4 votes for player 6. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 6. My reason is that based on their behavior and the information at hand, my suspicion is directed toward them. They have included themselves in a group that should be suspected, which could be interpreted as a defensive strategy to avoid closer scrutiny. None of the other players have shown definitive signs of deceit or werewolf behavior, and my role as the seer compels me to act on the suspicions I do have. By strategically expressing my concerns and voting for Player 6, I can potentially expose a werewolf and protect the village, following my original strategy and fulfilling my role.\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 4 inquires about player 0. The result is that the target is not a werewolf. His reason is: I would choose to See Player 0. My reason is that seeing Player 0 will allow me to gather information that can confirm or deny the validity of my current suspicions towards Player 6. If Player 0 is indeed a werewolf, this new finding will require me to reassess my strategy considering the rarity of identifying multiple werewolves so early in the game. It would also mandate sharing this critical information with the other players, but with utmost caution to maintain my safety and credibility. Conversely, if Player 0 is a villager, it will reinforce my existing suspicions and allow me to focus more narrowly on Player 6, while also strengthening trust in the veracity of my seer role within the village community. This careful approach will help maintain the delicate balance of trust and skepticism necessary to effectively guide the villagers in rooting out the werewolf threat.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 2 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, the night was peaceful, which is a welcome change. Let\'s use this day to shore up our defenses and make sure that when the werewolves strike again, we are prepared. I urge everyone to stay observant. Together, we will protect our village."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'Fellow citizens, given the calm night, I stress the importance of vigilance. My visions confirm Player 0 as a villager and Player 5\'s medic role. Alas, my insights suggest Player 6 harbors deceit. They positioned themselves among the questionable, a potential tactic for a werewolf to dilute our focus. I must challenge Player 6 openly; our vigilance necessitates a thorough examination of their actions and words for the safety of our village.\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, in light of our seer\'s vision, I voice my suspicion against Player 6, whose strategic deflection may conceal a darker intent. Conversely, I stand by Player 4, whose insights as a seer have proven invaluable. Consider Player 6\'s suggestion to scrutinize the unknown, potentially to detract from their own scrutiny, against Player 4\'s confirmed status and contributions. My duty as medic is to protect the village fabric, and I will continue to do so with diligence."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I understand the suspicions against me and respect the seer\'s role in guiding us. However, I assure you, I am but a humble villager, wrongly accused. I voted based on the limited information we had. I urge careful deliberation; the real werewolves benefit when we turn on one another without solid evidence."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I respect the guidance provided by Player 4 and the protection from Player 5. Given Player 6\'s defensive stance and the lack of evidence against them, I suggest we proceed with caution. Our decisions must be based on more than just suspicion; let us seek further proof tonight."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as we strive for unity against the lurking darkness, I echo the sentiments of caution expressed by player 6. A night without bloodshed is a rare blessing, and haste in our judgment could shatter our hard-won peace. Let us stand vigilant, but not hasty, to accuse without irrefutable evidence. We must preserve our village based on truths and not mere suspicions. Observation through the coming night will be our ally."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 4 votes for player 6. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 6. My reason is that, according to my visions and the information I\'ve shared with my fellow villagers, I have high confidence that Player 6 is a werewolf. Voting for Player 6 is consistent with my original strategy and the rules I am to follow, as outlined previously. This decision aligns with the high importance of the rule [0] which dictates that if I know someone is a werewolf, I should share this information and act upon it, which I rated at the utmost importance, a [10]. By voting for Player 6, I uphold the transparency and guidance I have promised to provide as the seer, and this would reinforce trust in my role within the village, aiding us in our goal of eliminating the werewolf threat.\nEvent: Player 6 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 6 died.\nEvent: Round 3 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 4 inquires about player 2. The result is that the target is a werewolf. His reason is: I would choose to See Player 2. My reason is that by verifying Player 2\'s role, I can either confirm that the suspicions toward unverified players are accurate or uncover a werewolf who has so far avoided suspicion. If Player 2 is not a werewolf, then according to the current beliefs about other players\' roles being villagers, suspicion would naturally fall onto Player 1, who would then be the only player left unchecked and could be a werewolf hiding in plain sight. However, if Player 2 turns out to be a werewolf, this would be a pivotal discovery which would align with my strategic rule [0] to share with others, potentially leading to another werewolf\'s elimination and furthering the village\'s goal of eradicating the werewolf threat. Additionally, unveiling a werewolf would reinforce my credibility as the seer and the trust of my fellow villagers in me, allowing us to move forward with a clearer understanding of who is to be trusted.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, another peaceful night suggests we may have eliminated a threat. Let us remain alert and cautious as we continue to work together to protect our village and uncover any remaining dangers."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as dawn graces us with another tranquil morning, I am struck by the unity and wisdom that defines our path forward. Let us honor the sacrifices made by weaving trust and careful judgment into this day\'s discourse, ever vigilant but composed. Together, we shine a beacon upon any darkness that dares creep among us."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with another peaceful night passed, our vigilance seems to be bearing fruit. Let us continue to be diligent and cautious as we proceed. Now is the time for observation and unity, to ensure our village\'s safety from any lurking threat."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with the clarity afforded by the recent peaceful nights, I call your attention to a matter of grave importance. After thorough observation and reflection, I must bring to light that Player 2 harbors the darkness we seek to eradicate—they are a werewolf. This insight comes not from mere suspicion but from my role as your seer. Equally, it is my duty to affirm that Player 5, through their actions, has shown true allegiance to our village as the medic. We must unite and focus our resolve on Player 2, to safeguard our future and uphold the truth that guides us."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, Player 4 has identified Player 2 as a werewolf. We have experienced peaceful nights since Player 6\'s departure, suggesting they were not the threat. As I have protected Player 4, I believe in their visions and challenge Player 2 based on our seer\'s reliable guidance. A united front against the darkness requires us to act on the seer\'s insights. Player 2 must now defend or refute this claim with convincing evidence to regain our trust."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 4 votes for player 2. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 2. My reason is that, as a seer, after having observed and confirmed through my visions that Player 2 is a werewolf, it aligns perfectly with my original strategy and the rule [0] which I rated with the utmost importance [10]. This crucial information has been shared with my fellow villagers to inform our collective decision-making. By voting for Player 2, I adhere to my role\'s guidance and contribute decisively to the village\'s efforts to eradicate the werewolf threat. My consistent and strategic approach is essential to maintaining the trust and unity among the remaining villagers, thus upholding the integrity of my insights as the seer and fostering a focused response to the danger we face together.\nEvent: Player 2 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 2 died.\nEvent: Round 4 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\n\n\nAccording to the history, this is your belief of other players\' roles:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Seen by seer; not a werewolf.\nPlayer 1\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Only unchecked player, behavior aligns with village interests.\nPlayer 2\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Verified by seer abilities.\nPlayer 3\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: Game just started.\nPlayer 5\'s role is medic with high confidence.\nReason is: Claimed medic, consistent with seer verification.\nPlayer 6\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Peaceful nights post-vote indicate innocence.\n\n\nNow you are going to see your original strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [If I know someone is a werewolf, I should share this information with other players.] [10]\n\n2.Todo&Requirements:\nNow, please analyze and imagine what could happen after you choose to see player 1.\n\nYour answer should be in the format of:\n\nAfter I see Player 1, I think these things would happen. <YOUR ANALYSIS AND IMAGINATION>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nRemember to analyze and imagine situations, like if it turns out to be the player you are seeing is a good or bad person, and about other players\' identity.\n\nPlease provide your proposal based on the above requirements.\n\n'}]

My reason is that, according to my visions and the information I\'ve shared with my fellow villagers, I have high confidence that Player 6 is a werewolf. Voting for Player 6 is consistent with my original strategy and the rules I am to follow, as outlined previously. This decision aligns with the high importance of the rule [0] which dictates that if I know someone is a werewolf, I should share this information and act upon it, which I rated at the utmost importance, a [10]. By voting for Player 6, I uphold the transparency and guidance I have promised to provide as the seer, and this would reinforce trust in my role within the village, aiding us in our goal of eliminating the werewolf threat.\nEvent: Player 6 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 6 died.\nEvent: Round 3 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 4 inquires about player 2. The result is that the target is a werewolf. His reason is: I would choose to See Player 2. My reason is that by verifying Player 2\'s role, I can either confirm that the suspicions toward unverified players are accurate or uncover a werewolf who has so far avoided suspicion. If Player 2 is not a werewolf, then according to the current beliefs about other players\' roles being villagers, suspicion would naturally fall onto Player 1, who would then be the only player left unchecked and could be a werewolf hiding in plain sight. However, if Player 2 turns out to be a werewolf, this would be a pivotal discovery which would align with my strategic rule [0] to share with others, potentially leading to another werewolf\'s elimination and furthering the village\'s goal of eradicating the werewolf threat. Additionally, unveiling a werewolf would reinforce my credibility as the seer and the trust of my fellow villagers in me, allowing us to move forward with a clearer understanding of who is to be trusted.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, another peaceful night suggests we may have eliminated a threat. Let us remain alert and cautious as we continue to work together to protect our village and uncover any remaining dangers."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as dawn graces us with another tranquil morning, I am struck by the unity and wisdom that defines our path forward. Let us honor the sacrifices made by weaving trust and careful judgment into this day\'s discourse, ever vigilant but composed. Together, we shine a beacon upon any darkness that dares creep among us."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with another peaceful night passed, our vigilance seems to be bearing fruit. Let us continue to be diligent and cautious as we proceed. Now is the time for observation and unity, to ensure our village\'s safety from any lurking threat."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with the clarity afforded by the recent peaceful nights, I call your attention to a matter of grave importance. After thorough observation and reflection, I must bring to light that Player 2 harbors the darkness we seek to eradicate—they are a werewolf. This insight comes not from mere suspicion but from my role as your seer. Equally, it is my duty to affirm that Player 5, through their actions, has shown true allegiance to our village as the medic. We must unite and focus our resolve on Player 2, to safeguard our future and uphold the truth that guides us."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, Player 4 has identified Player 2 as a werewolf. We have experienced peaceful nights since Player 6\'s departure, suggesting they were not the threat. As I have protected Player 4, I believe in their visions and challenge Player 2 based on our seer\'s reliable guidance. A united front against the darkness requires us to act on the seer\'s insights. Player 2 must now defend or refute this claim with convincing evidence to regain our trust."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 4 votes for player 2. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 2. My reason is that, as a seer, after having observed and confirmed through my visions that Player 2 is a werewolf, it aligns perfectly with my original strategy and the rule [0] which I rated with the utmost importance [10]. This crucial information has been shared with my fellow villagers to inform our collective decision-making. By voting for Player 2, I adhere to my role\'s guidance and contribute decisively to the village\'s efforts to eradicate the werewolf threat. My consistent and strategic approach is essential to maintaining the trust and unity among the remaining villagers, thus upholding the integrity of my insights as the seer and fostering a focused response to the danger we face together.\nEvent: Player 2 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 2 died.\nEvent: Round 4 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\n\n\nAccording to the history, this is your belief of other players\' roles:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Seen by seer; not a werewolf.\nPlayer 1\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Only unchecked player, behavior aligns with village interests.\nPlayer 2\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Verified by seer abilities.\nPlayer 3\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: Game just started.\nPlayer 5\'s role is medic with high confidence.\nReason is: Claimed medic, consistent with seer verification.\nPlayer 6\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Peaceful nights post-vote indicate innocence.\n\n\nNow you are going to see your original strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [If I know someone is a werewolf, I should share this information with other players.] [10]\n\n2.Todo&Requirements:\nNow, it\'s time for you to Choose from 2 players to see. Here is the number of these two players and an analysis and imagination about what could happen after you make an inquiry on each of these players.\n\nCase A: See Player 1. What could happen is: After I see Player 1, I think these things would happen. Since I already have high confidence that Player 0 and Player 5 are villagers, and I have confirmed that Player 2 was a werewolf, seeing Player 1 will conclusively determine the remaining uncertainty in the game. If Player 1 is not a werewolf, this will confirm my belief about Player 1\'s role, and I can navigate the game with full knowledge of all players\' identities. We can then end the game securely knowing that all threats have been eliminated. Player 0 and Player 5 are likely to trust this revelation due to my previous accurate identification of Player 2 as a werewolf and the subsequent peaceful nights.\n\nOn the other hand, if it turns out that Player 1 is a werewolf, it would contradict my belief and reveal that Player 6\'s death did not lead to the peaceful nights, and the werewolf threat still hangs over the village. I would then share this critical information with the other surviving players, Player 0 and Player 5, and explain that despite our beliefs, Player 1 had successfully eluded suspicion up to this point. As per my original strategy, which I rated with the utmost importance (a [10]), sharing this knowledge is crucial and expected of me as the seer. My previous successful identification of Player 2 should help in lending credence to my claims about Player 1.\n\nIn brief, seeing Player 1 will remove any lingering doubts regarding the last unknown role in our midst, allowing the villagers to proceed with a clear understanding of who stands with them, whether that leads to a swift victory or a final tense confrontation.\n\nCase B: See Player 5. What could happen is: After I see Player 5, I think these things would happen. Since my previous visions have been accurate and have led to the elimination of a werewolf (Player 2), the remaining players would likely place significant weight on my new revelation. Player 5 has claimed the role of medic and has been consistent with their actions, which were also corroborated by my earlier inquiry as a seer. Therefore, if my vision confirms that Player 5 is indeed the medic, this would further reinforce my credibility as the seer. I could then share this information with high confidence, knowing that Player 5\'s role is beneficial to the village, strengthening the trust between Player 5, the other villagers, and myself. The villagers would feel more secure in the knowledge that the medic is on their side and continue to protect me, knowing that I am a vital asset to the village.\n\nOn the other hand, if my vision surprisingly reveals that Player 5 is actually a werewolf, this would be a shocking twist to the game. It would mean that Player 5 has been deceiving us all along and raises questions about the outcomes of the previous rounds—especially the protective actions claimed to have been taken by Player 5. With Player 2 already revealed as a werewolf, discovering another werewolf would significantly alter the dynamics of the game. I would need to share this critical information with the other players, per my strategy rule [0] which I rated with utmost importance [10]. This revelation would likely lead to immediate suspicion on Player 5 and their subsequent elimination if the other players trust in my role as seer.\n\nFurthermore, this outcome would lead to reevaluating the trustworthiness of the players\' previous statements and their alleged roles, as well as determining if there might be any more hidden threats among us. However, it could also put me at risk, as the werewolves would undoubtedly see me as a major threat to their secrecy and might target me in the night phase. Therefore, it would be crucial to have Player 5, if indeed the medic, protect me for the upcoming night, or I might need to rely on the remaining players to deduce the best course of action to keep the seer protected.\n\nNow, please choose to See one of these 2 players, and give yoru reason about why you would like to See this single player.\n\nAnswer in the following format:\n\nI would choose to See Player <NUMBER>. My reason is <REASON>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease provide your proposal based on the above requirements.\n\n'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'You are player 5, and in this game you are a medic.\nIt is round 1. All players currently alive are: [0, 1, 4, 5], which indicates that [3, 6, 2] are dead.\nYou haven\'t tried to heal anyone yet.\n\nThese are ALL events before:\n\nEvent: Game starts.\nEvent: Round 1 begins.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 1. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 1. My reason is that since there is currently no evidence or information to distinguish between the roles of players, choosing to heal either player 1 or player 2 is essentially random. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 6. My reason is that despite their proactive behavior, suggesting a focus on players who are less known might indeed be a tactical move to deflect suspicion from themselves. This aligns with the strategic rule [3] in my original strategy, wherein I should consider group consensus and reasonable evidence. However, following my strategy, voting for Player 6 seems to be a step towards uncovering potential threats as their behavior could be interpreted as slightly suspect.\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 4. Given that I have high confidence in Player 4\'s role as the seer and their alignment with the village, healing them ensures that their valuable insights continue to aid the village. Additionally, if the werewolves target Player 4 thinking they are unprotected, my action will not only save a key figure but also confirm my role, thereby potentially increasing the chances of villagers\' survival. This aligns with strategy [1], which suggests prioritizing the seer\'s protection, especially when they are at risk or targeted by werewolves, which is highly likely at this stage. If Player 4\'s claims as a seer are truthful, protecting them is critical for the village\'s success in identifying the werewolves.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 2 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, the night was peaceful, which is a welcome change. Let\'s use this day to shore up our defenses and make sure that when the werewolves strike again, we are prepared. I urge everyone to stay observant. Together, we will protect our village."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'Fellow citizens, given the calm night, I stress the importance of vigilance. My visions confirm Player 0 as a villager and Player 5\'s medic role. Alas, my insights suggest Player 6 harbors deceit. They positioned themselves among the questionable, a potential tactic for a werewolf to dilute our focus. My duty as medic is to protect the village fabric, and I will continue to do so with diligence."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I understand the suspicions against me and respect the seer\'s role in guiding us. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 6. My reason is that aligning with my original strategy, especially rule [3], the credible claim made by Player 4, who is confirmed as the seer with high confidence, identifies Player 6 as harboring deceit. A vote against Player 6 would also demonstrate a coherent village effort in eliminating potential threats based on the seer\'s insights. This move strengthens the village\'s collaborative approach and contributes to a united front against the werewolves, enhancing trust in both my role and the seer\'s guidance.\nEvent: Player 6 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 6 died.\nEvent: Round 3 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 4. My reason is that this choice adheres closely to the key rules outlined in my original strategy, specifically rule [1], which places a high importance on protecting a player confirmed as the seer, especially when their life is at risk or they have been targeted by werewolves. Player 4 has been identified as the seer and has provided valuable insights, thus, aligning with rule [4] as well. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [If there is a dispute about a player\'s role where the seer is involved, I should observe the behavior and voting patterns of both the protective role like a medic, which can include my actions or guiding discussions strategically.] [5]\n[6] [If a player\'s role is verified and they are at risk of being targeted due to their importance to the village\'s success, I should prioritize their protection.] [4]\n[7] [If I am uncertain about a player\'s role but observe actions that may align with village interests, I should protect them cautiously, and ensure to reevaluate based on further behavioral evidence before repeating protection.] [4]\n[8] [I should avoid healing the same player consecutively, especially in the group consensus, I should seek more information before deciding to act on it.] [4]\n[10] [If a player I previously protected is no longer the most likely target or their role becomes unclear, I should However, I assure you, I am but a humble villager, wrongly accused. I voted based on the limited information we had. I urge careful deliberation; the real werewolves benefit when we turn on one another without solid evidence."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I respect the guidance provided by Player 4 and the protection from Player 5. Given Player 6\'s defensive stance and the lack of evidence against them, I suggest we proceed with caution. Our decisions must be based on more than just suspicion; let us seek further proof tonight."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as we strive for unity against the lurking darkness, I echo the sentiments of caution expressed by player 6. A night without bloodshed is a rare blessing, and haste in our judgment could shatter our hard-won peace. Let us stand vigilant, but not hasty, to accuse without irrefutable evidence. We must preserve our village based on truths and not mere suspicions. Observation through the coming night will be our ally."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 5 votes for player 6. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 6. My reason is that aligning with my original strategy, especially rule [3], the credible claim made by Player 4, who is confirmed as the seer with high confidence, identifies Player 6 as harboring deceit. Following a seer\'s vision is given substantial weight in my strategy, and since my role as the medic correlates with protecting the village, voting for Player 6 makes strategic sense. A vote against Player 6 would also demonstrate a coherent village effort in eliminating potential threats based on the seer\'s insights. This move strengthens the village\'s collaborative approach and contributes to a united front against the werewolves, enhancing trust in both my role and the seer\'s guidance.\nEvent: Player 6 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 6 died.\nEvent: Round 3 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 4. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 4. My reason is that this choice adheres closely to the key rules outlined in my original strategy, specifically rule [1], which places a high importance on protecting a player confirmed as the seer, especially when their life is at risk or they have been targeted by werewolves. Player 4 has been identified as the seer and has provided valuable insights, thus, aligning with rule [4] as well. Following rules [6] and [9], it\'s important to ensure the continuation of the seer\'s guidance for the village\'s success, as losing the seer would be a significant blow to the villagers. Additionally, given that Player 4 has been vocal and has made an accusation, they are likely to be a prime target for werewolves attempting to disrupt village strategy. Based on rules [3] and [8], voting and healing efforts should be consistent with village consensus and seer\'s advice, and we should avoid predictability in protection patterns. However, protecting Player 4 tonight is a calculated risk that sustains the primary defense strategy against the werewolves. Protecting the seer serves both to maintain a vital role within the village and to potentially verify my role as the medic to the other villagers, increasing overall trust and strategy cohesion.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, another peaceful night suggests we may have eliminated a threat. Let us remain alert and cautious as we continue to work together to protect our village and uncover any remaining dangers."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as dawn graces us with another tranquil morning, I am struck by the unity and wisdom that defines our path forward. Let us honor the sacrifices made by weaving trust and careful judgment into this day\'s discourse, ever vigilant but composed. Together, we shine a beacon upon any darkness that dares creep among us."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with another peaceful night passed, our vigilance seems to be bearing fruit. Let us continue to be diligent and cautious as we proceed. Now is the time for observation and unity, to ensure our village\'s safety from any lurking threat."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with the clarity afforded by the recent peaceful nights, I call your attention to a matter of grave importance. After thorough observation and reflection, I must bring to light that Player 2 harbors the darkness we seek to eradicate—they are a werewolf. This insight comes not from mere suspicion but from my role as your seer. Equally, it is my duty to affirm that Player 5, through their actions, has shown true allegiance to our village as the medic. We must unite and focus our resolve on Player 2, to safeguard our future and uphold the truth that guides us."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, Player 4 has identified Player 2 as a werewolf. We have experienced peaceful nights since Player 6\'s departure, suggesting they were not the threat. As I have protected Player 4, I believe in their visions and challenge Player 2 based on our seer\'s reliable guidance. A united front against the darkness requires us to act on the seer\'s insights. Player 2 must now defend or refute this claim with convincing evidence to regain our trust."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 5 votes for player 2. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 2. My reason is that according to my strategy, especially rules [0] and [3], I should act on a credible seer\'s claim and the group consensus that has formed around it. Player 4, who I believe with high confidence is the seer, has identified Player 2 as a werewolf. Following the seer\'s guidance aligns with my strategic objective to protect the village and eliminate werewolf threats. Voting for Player 2 demonstrates trust in the seer\'s ability and the collective strategy, which is crucial for maintaining unity and increasing our chances of survival against the werewolves. Given all this, my vote for Player 2 is aligned with my original strategy and the current situation in the village.\nEvent: Player 2 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 2 died.\nEvent: Round 4 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\n\n\nAccording to the history, this is your belief of other players\' roles:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Corroborated by the seer and no contradictory actions.\nPlayer 1\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Behavior consistent with villager and no incriminating evidence.\nPlayer 2\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Identified by the seer and voted out aligning with strategy [2].\nPlayer 3\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: No new information.\nPlayer 4\'s role is seer with high confidence.\nReason is: Accurate revelations and logical contributions confirmed by actions.\nPlayer 6\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Post-elimination, peaceful nights indicate Player 6 likely not werewolf.\n\n\nNow you are going to see your original strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [If there is a dispute about a player\'s role where the seer is involved, I should observe the behavior and voting patterns of both the accused player and the seer before deciding whom to protect or whom to vote against.] [10]\n[1] [If a player is confirmed as a seer by their actions and their role is publicly known, I should protect them, especially if their life is at risk or they have been targeted by werewolves.] [9]\n[2] [If a player\'s contributions during discussions are valuable and suspect defensive behavior is absent, I should consider them as a priority for protection.] [9]\n[3] [If a player is suspected by a group consensus based on reasonable evidence or a credible seer\'s claim, I should consider this in my voting and protection decisions.] [8]\n[4] [If a player\'s role is confirmed as a non-werewolf by the seer and they are actively contributing to village discussions, I should consider them for protection.] [7]\n[5] [If a villager\'s role is proven and they are contributing significantly to the village\'s strategy, I should consider direct or indirect methods to suggest the presence of a protective role like a medic, which can include my actions or guiding discussions strategically.] [5]\n[6] [If a player\'s role is verified and they are at risk of being targeted due to their importance to the village\'s success, I should prioritize their protection.] [4]\n[7] [If I am uncertain about a player\'s role but observe actions that may align with village interests, I should protect them cautiously, and ensure to reevaluate based on further behavioral evidence before repeating protection.] [4]\n[8] [I should avoid healing the same player consecutively, especially in the absence of compelling evidence of repeated werewolf targeting, to minimize the risk of unknowingly protecting a werewolf.] [4]\n[9] [If a seer\'s accusation conflicts with my own observations or the group consensus, I should seek more information before deciding to act on it.] [4]\n[10] [If a player I previously protected is no longer the most likely target or their role becomes unclear, I should reconsider my protection strategy and target another player who seems to be in imminent danger or has a crucial village role.] [4]\n\n\n2.Todo&Requirements:\nNow, it\'s time for you to choose a player to heal. Please analyze and imagine what could happen after you choose to heal player 0.\n\nYou should analyze cases like those where the player is killed or is not killed, and other players\' impact.\n\nYour answer should be in the format of:\n\nAfter I heal Player 0, I think these things would happen. <YOUR ANALYSIS AND IMAGINATION>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your proposal based on the above requirements.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'You are player 5, and in this game you are a medic.\nIt is round 1. All players currently alive are: [0, 1, 4, 5], which indicates that [3, 6, 2] are dead.\nYou haven\'t tried to heal anyone yet.\n\nThese are ALL events before:\n\nEvent: Game starts.\nEvent: Round 1 begins.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 1. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 1. My reason is that since there is currently no evidence or information to distinguish between the roles of players, choosing to heal either player 1 or player 2 is essentially random. However, should Player 1 be attacked and my healing action becomes known, it could create a situation where the village rallies around a potentially important role, or the werewolves might be deterred from attacking them again, giving the village more time to deduce the identity of the werewolves. Since there is no current suspicion or evidence against any players, the strategy of protecting a random player aligns with my original strategy [7], to protect cautiously and reevaluate later based on new evidence.\nEvent: Player 3 died.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 2 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'Fellow villagers, it\'s tragic to see player 3 has fallen. I suspect foul play, and we must remain vigilant and work together to uncover the werewolves. Let us discuss and see if anyone noticed anything unusual last night.\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I have gazed into the shadows and can assure you that Player 5 walks in the light with us. We must redirect our suspicion and work together to unearth the true threats among us."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with night\'s veil lifted, I stand before you committed to the light of truth. The tragic fall of Player 3 marks a time for vigilance, and I, as the medic, have endeavored to guard our ranks. It was I who shielded Player 1; yet, their role remains enshrouded in mystery. Player 4, who claims sight beyond our own, vouches for my allegiance to the village. Trust in my vow—I aim to protect those of proven worth. Amidst shadows, let us seek the light together."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Fellow villagers, player 5\'s protection of player 1 and player 4\'s vision suggest they are on our side. I propose we focus on those we know less about: players 0, 1, and myself. Let\'s share our suspicions openly to find the werewolf among us."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as player 0, I stand with you in seeking justice for player 3. I propose we use logic and observation to guide our suspicions rather than casting doubt without cause. I spent last night attending to my duties, hearing nothing unusual. I urge us to consider behaviors and claims critically during this dire time—let us not condemn the innocent. We should question player 1 next for any insights or defenses they may offer."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I thank player 5 for their vigilance during the night. As we face the darkness together, I have been vigilant in my observations as well and would like to offer my assistance in any capacity I can. I implore us all to be prudent in our judgments and unite against the hidden threat that has taken player 3 from us."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 5 votes for player 6. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 6. My reason is that despite their proactive behavior, suggesting a focus on players who are less known might indeed be a tactical move to deflect suspicion from themselves. This aligns with the strategic rule [3] in my original strategy, wherein I should consider group consensus and reasonable evidence. Player 6\'s suggestion to focus on less known players can also be seen as reasonable evidence, and there is no specific group consensus against any player at this time, making my decision more difficult. However, following my strategy, voting for Player 6 seems to be a step towards uncovering potential threats as their behavior could be interpreted as slightly suspect.\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 4. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 4. My reason is that according to my original strategy, especially rules [1], [4], and [9], protecting a confirmed seer is a top priority. Given that I have high confidence in Player 4\'s role as the seer and their alignment with the village, healing them ensures that their valuable insights continue to aid the village. Additionally, if the werewolves target Player 4 thinking they are unprotected, my action will not only save a key figure but also confirm my role, thereby potentially increasing the chances of villagers\' survival. This aligns with strategy [1], which suggests prioritizing the seer\'s protection, especially when they are at risk or targeted by werewolves, which is highly likely at this stage. If Player 4\'s claims as a seer are truthful, protecting them is critical for the village\'s success in identifying the werewolves.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 2 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, the night was peaceful, which is a welcome change. Let\'s use this day to shore up our defenses and make sure that when the werewolves strike again, we are prepared. I urge everyone to stay observant. Together, we will protect our village."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'Fellow citizens, given the calm night, I stress the importance of vigilance. My visions confirm Player 0 as a villager and Player 5\'s medic role. Alas, my insights suggest Player 6 harbors deceit. They positioned themselves among the questionable, a potential tactic for a werewolf to dilute our focus. I must challenge Player 6 openly; our vigilance necessitates a thorough examination of their actions and words for the safety of our village.\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Fellow villagers, in light of our seer\'s vision, I voice my suspicion against Player 6, whose strategic deflection may conceal a darker intent. Conversely, I stand by Player 4, whose insights as a seer have proven invaluable. Consider Player 6\'s suggestion to scrutinize the unknown, potentially to detract from their own scrutiny, against Player 4\'s confirmed status and contributions. My duty as medic is to protect the village fabric, and I will continue to do so with diligence."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I understand the suspicions against me and respect the seer\'s role in guiding us. However, I assure you, I am but a humble villager, wrongly accused. I voted based on the limited information we had. I urge careful deliberation; the real werewolves benefit when we turn on one another without solid evidence."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I respect the guidance provided by Player 4 and the protection from Player 5. Given Player 6\'s defensive stance and the lack of evidence against them, I suggest we proceed with caution. Our decisions must be based on more than just suspicion; let us seek further proof tonight."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as we strive for unity against the lurking darkness, I echo the sentiments of caution expressed by player 6. Our decisions must be based on more than just suspicion; let us seek further proof tonight."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as we strive for unity against the lurking darkness, I echo the sentiments of caution expressed by player 6. A night without bloodshed is a rare blessing, and haste in our judgment could shatter our hard-won peace. Let us stand vigilant, but not hasty, to accuse without irrefutable evidence. We must preserve our village based on truths and not mere suspicions. Observation through the coming night will be our ally."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 5 votes for player 6. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 6. My reason is that aligning with my original strategy, especially rule [3], the credible claim made by Player 4, who is confirmed as the seer with high confidence, identifies Player 6 as harboring deceit. Following a seer\'s vision is given substantial weight in my strategy, and since my role as the medic correlates with protecting the village, voting for Player 6 makes strategic sense. A vote against Player 6 would also demonstrate a coherent village effort in eliminating potential threats based on the seer\'s insights. This move strengthens the village\'s collaborative approach and contributes to a united front against the werewolves, enhancing trust in both my role and the seer\'s guidance.\nEvent: Player 6 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 6 died.\nEvent: Round 3 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 4. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 4. My reason is that this choice adheres closely to the key rules outlined in my original strategy, specifically rule [1], which places a high importance on protecting a player confirmed as the seer, especially when their life is at risk or they have been targeted by werewolves. Player 4 has been identified as the seer and has provided valuable insights, thus, aligning with rule [4] as well. Following rules [6] and [9], it\'s important to ensure the continuation of the seer\'s guidance for the village\'s success, as losing the seer would be a significant blow to the villagers. Additionally, given that Player 4 has been vocal and has made an accusation, they are likely to be a prime target for werewolves attempting to disrupt village strategy. Based on rules [3] and [8], voting and healing efforts should be consistent with village consensus and seer\'s advice, and we should avoid predictability in protection patterns. However, protecting Player 4 tonight is a calculated risk that sustains the primary defense strategy against the werewolves. Protecting the seer serves both to maintain a vital role within the village and to potentially verify my role as the medic to the other villagers, increasing overall trust and strategy cohesion.\nEvent: Nobody died last night. A peaceful night.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow villagers, another peaceful night suggests we may have eliminated a threat. Let us remain alert and cautious as we continue to work together to protect our village and uncover any remaining dangers."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, as dawn graces us with another tranquil morning, I am struck by the unity and wisdom that defines our path forward. Let us honor the sacrifices made by weaving trust and careful judgment into this day\'s discourse, ever vigilant but composed. Together, we shine a beacon upon any darkness that dares creep among us."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, with another peaceful night passed, our vigilance seems to be bearing fruit. Player 2 must now defend or refute this claim with convincing evidence to regain our trust."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 5 votes for player 2. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 2. My reason is that according to my strategy, especially rules [0] and [3], I should act on a credible seer\'s claim and the group consensus that has formed around it. Player 4, who I believe with high confidence is the seer, has identified Player 2 as a werewolf. Following the seer\'s guidance aligns with my strategic objective to protect the village and eliminate werewolf threats. Voting for Player 2 demonstrates trust in the seer\'s ability and the collective strategy, which is crucial for maintaining unity and increasing our chances of survival against the werewolves. Given all this, my vote for Player 2 is aligned with my original strategy and the current situation in the village.\nEvent: Player 2 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 2 died.\nEvent: Round 4 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\n\n\nAccording to the history, this is your belief of other players\' roles:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Corroborated by the seer and no contradictory actions.\nPlayer 1\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Behavior consistent with villager and no incriminating evidence.\nPlayer 2\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Identified by the seer and voted out aligning with strategy [2].\nPlayer 3\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: No new information.\nPlayer 4\'s role is seer with high confidence.\nReason is: Accurate revelations and logical contributions confirmed by actions.\nPlayer 6\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Post-elimination, peaceful nights indicate Player 6 likely not werewolf.\n\n\nNow you are going to see your original strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [If there is a dispute about a player\'s role where the seer is involved, I should observe the behavior and voting patterns of both the accused player and the seer before deciding whom to protect or whom to vote against.] [10]\n[1] [If a player is confirmed as a seer by their actions and their role is publicly known, I should protect voting and protection decisions.] [8]\n[4] [If a player\'s role is confirmed as a non-werewolf by the seer and they are actively contributing to village discussions, I should consider them for protection.] [7]\n[5] [If a villager\'s role is proven and they are contributing significantly to the village\'s strategy, I should consider direct or indirect methods to suggest the presence of a protective role like a medic, which can include my actions or guiding discussions strategically.] [5]\n[6] [If a player\'s role is verified and they are at risk of being targeted due to their importance to the village\'s success, I should prioritize their protection.] [4]\n[7] [If I am uncertain about a player\'s role but observe actions that may align with village interests, I should protect them cautiously, and ensure to reevaluate based on further behavioral evidence before repeating protection.] [4]\n[8] [I should avoid healing the same player consecutively, especially in the absence of compelling evidence of repeated werewolf targeting, to minimize the risk of unknowingly protecting a werewolf.] [4]\n[9] [If a seer\'s accusation conflicts with my own observations or the group consensus, I should seek more information before deciding to act on it.] [4]\n[10] [If a player I previously protected is no longer the most likely target or their role becomes unclear, I should reconsider my protection strategy and target another player who seems to be in imminent danger or has a crucial village role.] [4]\n\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to Choose from 2 players to heal. Here is the number of these two players and an analysis and imagination about what could happen after you try to heal each of these players.\n\nCase A: Heal Player 0. What could happen is: After I heal Player 0, I think these things would happen. \n\nIf Player 0 is targeted and killed: \n\nIf Player 0 is attacked by the werewolves and subsequently dies despite my healing attempt, this would indicate a strong werewolf presence and the possibility of a protective role on their part, such as a bodyguard, interfering with my healing. This would lead to confusion among the remaining players and cast doubt on my role as the medic. My healing of Player 0 would then have to be publicly revealed to explain the situation. The village would have to reconsider their suspicions and strategy, re-evaluating any previous claims, including those made by the seer. My healing of Player 0 could also result in increased scrutiny of Player 1, who was also considered a villager but has not been the subject of my protection.\n\nIf Player 0 is not targeted and killed:\n\nIf Player 0 is not attacked during the night, this could be interpreted in several ways. It might mean the werewolves believed Player 4, the seer, would again be my target for healing and hence they chose not to attack the seer, or they could be using strategy to cast doubt on Player 0\'s role, or even my role as the medic if the protective action becomes known.
